content.checklist_title: Performance Disclosure for Short-Term Funds
content.checklist_description: For Overnight funds, Liquid funds, and Money Market funds, disclose performance by simple annualization of yields if performance data is available for at least 7, 15, and 30 days, ensuring the figures are not misleading or unrealistic.
content.rationale: To provide appropriate performance metrics for funds with short investment horizons, reflecting their unique characteristics.

content.checklist_title: Benchmark Disclosure in SID
content.checklist_description: Disclose scheme benchmarks along with additional standardized benchmarks in INR and CAGR format as per scheme category (e.g., Sensex/Nifty for equity schemes, 1-year T-Bill for short-term debt schemes, 10-year GOI security for long-term debt schemes, etc.). This disclosure should be part of the Statement of Additional Information and all advertisements.
content.rationale: To enable investors to compare scheme performance against relevant market benchmarks, ensuring transparency and standardization.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Performance Periods
content.checklist_description: Ensure that any quarterly, half-yearly, or yearly performance disclosures pertain strictly to the respective calendar periods only.
content.rationale: To maintain consistency and avoid confusion regarding the time frames of performance data.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Fund Manager's Other Schemes Performance
content.checklist_description: When advertising a scheme's performance, also disclose the CAGR performance data (1, 3, and 5 years) of all other schemes managed by the same fund manager along with their respective benchmarks. If the fund manager manages more than six schemes, disclose the total number of schemes managed and provide performance data of the top 3 and bottom 3 schemes, ensuring a true and fair view.
content.rationale: To provide investors with a comprehensive view of the fund manager's track record and ensure transparency about management expertise.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Fund Manager Tenure
content.checklist_description: If the scheme has not been managed by the same fund manager for the entire period of performance data disclosed, this must be clearly stated in a footnote.
content.rationale: To inform investors about changes in management which may impact scheme performance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Performance Post-Merger
content.checklist_description: Disclose weighted average performance of merged schemes if features are similar and retained. If features of one scheme are retained post-merger, disclose performance of that scheme. If a new scheme emerges post-merger, past performance need not be provided. Past performance of schemes whose features are not retained may be made available on request with adequate disclaimers.
content.rationale: To provide clarity on performance representation post-merger and avoid misleading disclosures.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Unclaimed Redemption and Dividend Amounts
content.checklist_description: Disclose in the SID/SAI the policy regarding unclaimed redemption and dividend amounts, including their deployment in specified Overnight/Liquid/Money Market schemes, restrictions on exit load and TER, investor claim process, and efforts made by AMCs to trace rightful owners. Also disclose the number of investors with unclaimed amounts in the Annual Report.
content.rationale: To ensure investor awareness and transparency regarding unclaimed amounts and their management.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Indicative Portfolio and Yield Restrictions
content.checklist_description: Disclose the credit evaluation policy, sectors excluded from investment, types of instruments proposed for investment, and floors and ceilings (within 5% range) of intended allocation by sub-asset class/credit rating in the SID/SAI/KIM for close-ended debt-oriented schemes. Do not provide indicative portfolio or yield figures directly or indirectly.
content.rationale: To provide investors with relevant investment strategy information while preventing misleading indicative yield or portfolio promises.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investor Rights on Redemption Proceeds
content.checklist_description: Disclose the timelines for transfer of redemption or repurchase proceeds (within 3 working days for domestic schemes, 5 working days for overseas investment schemes), interest payable for delays, and exceptional circumstances as per AMFI guidelines.
content.rationale: To inform investors of their rights regarding timely receipt of redemption proceeds and remedies in case of delay.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Statement of Account Dispatch
content.checklist_description: Disclose that units will be allotted and confirmation sent via email/SMS within 5 working days from closure of initial subscription or receipt of request. Provide option to hold units in demat form with respective ISINs disclosed. Disclose consolidated account statement issuance timelines and contents including commission paid to distributors and expense ratios.
content.rationale: To ensure investors receive timely and comprehensive information about their investments and holdings.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Mandatory PAN and Bank Account Details
content.checklist_description: Disclose the mandatory requirement for investors to provide PAN number and bank account details in application and redemption forms.
content.rationale: To comply with regulatory requirements for investor identification and secure payment processing.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Certification and Registration Requirements for Intermediaries
content.checklist_description: Disclose that no AMC shall deal with intermediaries (distributors, agents, brokers) unless they have cleared the mandatory certification examination. Include exemptions, code of conduct adherence, due diligence processes for empanelment, and ongoing monitoring requirements.
content.rationale: To ensure that intermediaries are qualified and adhere to ethical standards, protecting investor interests.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Distributor Due Diligence and Conflict of Interest
content.checklist_description: Disclose the due diligence process for distributors including fit and proper criteria, business model, regulatory history, organizational controls, and conflict of interest disclosures when selling group/associate products.
content.rationale: To promote transparency and investor protection by ensuring distributors are suitable and disclose conflicts.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Transaction and Documentation Maintenance
content.checklist_description: Disclose that AMCs are responsible for maintaining all investor documentation including KYC, PAN, PoA, specimen signatures, and transaction records. Disclose procedures for incomplete documentation and investor confirmation of holdings.
content.rationale: To comply with AML/CFT regulations and ensure investor records are complete and accurate.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Mutual Fund Transactions via Stock Exchange Infrastructure
content.checklist_description: Disclose that mutual fund units can be transacted through registered stock brokers and clearing members, who must comply with certification, code of conduct, and KYC requirements. Disclose investor grievance mechanisms, time stamping provisions, and demat account related disclosures.
content.rationale: To inform investors about alternative transaction channels and associated regulatory safeguards.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Discontinuation of Pool Accounts
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose in the SID that pooling of funds and/or units by intermediaries such as stock brokers, clearing members, mutual fund distributors (MFDs), investment advisors (IAs), and other service providers is discontinued. The SID should specify that funds pay-in and pay-out will be directly handled by recognized clearing corporations and units will be credited/debited directly to/from investor demat or folio accounts without routing through pool accounts.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and safeguard investor interests by eliminating risks associated with pooling of funds and units, thereby enhancing traceability and reducing misuse of investor monies.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Payment and Redemption Mechanism
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose that cheque payments from investors shall be accepted only in favor of the respective mutual fund schemes and that redemption proceeds will be paid directly to the investor's registered bank account without any intermediate pooling. It should also mention that payment aggregators authorized by RBI or SEBI recognized clearing corporations may be used for routing funds, subject to strict controls.
content.rationale: To prevent third-party payments and co-mingling of funds, ensuring that investor payments and redemptions are secure, traceable, and compliant with regulatory requirements.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) Requirement
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose that two-factor authentication is mandatory for online subscription and redemption transactions, with one factor being a One-Time Password (OTP) sent to the investor's registered email or phone number. For offline transactions, signature verification is required. For demat transactions, authentication as prescribed by Depositories shall be followed.
content.rationale: To enhance security of mutual fund transactions and protect investors from unauthorized transactions and fraud.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of AMC Liability for Unauthorized Transactions
content.checklist_description: The SID must state that the Asset Management Company (AMC) shall be liable to compensate unit holders for losses arising from unauthorized transactions due to fraud, negligence, or deficiency on the part of the AMC or its service providers, including platform providers, MFDs, RTAs, MFUs, and channel partners. However, unauthorized transactions by Investment Advisors are excluded from AMC liability.
content.rationale: To protect investors by ensuring accountability of AMCs for safeguarding investor assets and transactions.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investor Servicing and Information Sharing Protocols
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose that detailed, system-generated, and secured information related to each stage of mutual fund transactions, including rejections, will be made available simultaneously to all relevant stakeholders such as investors, RTAs, MFDs, IAs, and payment aggregators (limited to payment-related data). It should also mention that costs for system development will not be passed on to investors.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency, timely communication, and parity in information dissemination among all stakeholders involved in mutual fund transactions.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Segregation and Ring-Fencing of Scheme Assets
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose that AMCs maintain internal policies approved by their Board and Trustees to ensure segregation and ring-fencing of assets, liabilities, bank accounts, and securities accounts of each scheme on a daily basis. Pool accounts, if used for mutual fund level transactions, shall have nil balance at the end of the day, and any unidentified funds must be allocated to respective schemes within one business day.
content.rationale: To prevent co-mingling of assets across schemes and protect investor interests by ensuring clear segregation of scheme assets.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Margin and Collateral Requirements
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose that margins or collaterals for transactions executed at the mutual fund level are placed only from the assets of the respective schemes without co-mingling with assets of other schemes.
content.rationale: To ensure that scheme assets are used exclusively for their own transactions, maintaining fairness and compliance with regulatory requirements.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Cash Investment Limits and Conditions
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose that cash investments in mutual funds are permitted up to Rs. 50,000 per investor per mutual fund per financial year, subject to compliance with AML and PMLA provisions and having sufficient systems and procedures in place. Redemption or dividend payments related to such investments will be made only through banking channels.
content.rationale: To facilitate inclusion of small investors while ensuring compliance with anti-money laundering regulations and safeguarding investor interests.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Corporate Debt Market Development Fund (CDMDF) Investment
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose any investment in the Corporate Debt Market Development Fund (CDMDF), including the requirement for specified debt-oriented schemes to invest 25 basis points of their AUM in CDMDF units, the lock-in of contributions until winding up, and the treatment of CDMDF units in risk and maturity calculations. It should also mention that changes related to CDMDF investment will be incorporated by addendum and are not considered fundamental attribute changes.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the scheme’s participation in CDMDF, its impact on scheme portfolio, and regulatory compliance related to such investments.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Execution Only Platforms (EOP) Usage and Framework
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose if transactions in direct plans are facilitated through Execution Only Platforms (EOPs), describing the nature of EOPs, their registration categories, and the segregation of advisory and distribution activities. It should also disclose the risk management framework, investor onboarding procedures, grievance redressal mechanisms, and conflict of interest policies applicable to EOPs.
content.rationale: To provide transparency about the use of technology platforms for direct plan transactions and ensure investor protection through regulated frameworks.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Mutual Fund Scheme Information on EOPs
content.checklist_description: The SID should state that EOPs displaying mutual fund schemes will provide factual information available in the public domain, including past performance, and comply with minimum disclosure requirements. It should also mention that EOPs will provide interactive tools for scheme screening without auto-recommendations or rankings, and any research reports used will be from SEBI registered intermediaries with appropriate disclosures.
content.rationale: To ensure that investors receive unbiased, factual, and compliant information when transacting through EOPs.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investor Authentication and Transaction Execution
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose that investor orders placed through EOPs are executed immediately and routed either directly to AMCs/RTAs (Category 1 EOPs) or through stock exchange platforms (Category 2 EOPs). It should also mention the requirement for robust technology infrastructure ensuring data privacy, security, and continuous platform availability.
content.rationale: To assure investors of timely execution and secure handling of their transactions on digital platforms.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Fund Manager Appointment and Portfolio Replication
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose in the SID that separate fund managers are appointed for each fund unless the investment objectives and asset allocations are the same and the portfolio is replicated across funds. Portfolio replication of at least 70% is considered adequate. The AMC must have a written policy for trade allocation ensuring the fund manager does not take directionally opposite positions across schemes.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency about fund management and to prevent conflicts of interest or contradictory investment strategies across schemes managed by the same fund manager, as mandated by SEBI (Mutual Funds) Regulations.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Fund Manager Performance Across Schemes
content.checklist_description: AMCs must disclose on their websites the monthly returns provided by each fund manager across all schemes managed by them, including mutual funds, pension funds, and offshore funds. In performance advertisements, returns of all schemes managed by the fund manager must be provided. If the difference between annual returns of schemes managed by the same fund manager exceeds 10%, this must be reported to the trustee and explained on the AMC’s website.
content.rationale: To provide investors with comprehensive performance information of fund managers and maintain accountability and transparency regarding fund manager performance.

content.checklist_title: Product Labeling with Risk-o-meter in Scheme Documents
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose a product label on the front page of the SID, Key Information Memorandum (KIM), initial offering application forms, common application forms, and scheme advertisements. The label should include: (a) nature of the scheme (wealth creation or regular income with indicative time horizon), (b) brief investment objective and product type (Equity/Debt), and (c) risk level depicted through a pictorial 'Risk-o-meter' with six defined risk levels (Low to Very High). The risk-o-meter must be prominently visible near the scheme caption.
content.rationale: To standardize risk communication and help investors understand the risk profile of schemes clearly and consistently, facilitating informed investment decisions.

content.checklist_title: Monthly and Annual Disclosure of Risk-o-meter
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must evaluate and disclose the Risk-o-meter for each scheme monthly along with portfolio disclosures on their website and AMFI website within 10 days from month-end. Additionally, the risk level as on March 31 each year, along with the number of times the risk level changed during the year, must be disclosed on both websites. Annual reports and abridged summaries must include a table showing scheme-wise Risk-o-meter levels at the start and end of the financial year and the number of changes.
content.rationale: To keep investors updated on the dynamic risk profile of schemes and maintain transparency regarding changes in risk levels over time.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Risk Value for Commodities in Risk-o-meter
content.checklist_description: For mutual fund schemes investing in commodities, the risk value assigned in the Risk-o-meter must be based on the annualized volatility of the commodity’s benchmark index price over the past 15 years, computed quarterly. The risk value corresponds to defined volatility ranges (e.g., <10% = Moderate risk, >20% = Very High risk). This methodology and examples must be disclosed.
content.rationale: To provide a consistent and quantitative basis for assessing commodity investment risk, enhancing transparency and comparability.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Potential Risk Class (PRC) Matrix for Debt Schemes
content.checklist_description: Debt mutual funds must disclose the classification of their schemes in a 3x3 Potential Risk Class matrix based on maximum interest rate risk (Macaulay Duration) and maximum credit risk (Credit Risk Value). The chosen PRC cell must be disclosed in the SID at the time of filing with SEBI, on the front page of the initial offering application form, KIM, common application form, and scheme advertisements. The PRC matrix with the scheme’s position must be prominently visible and in bold near the scheme caption. Any subsequent changes in PRC classification must be communicated to unitholders via SMS and website link.
content.rationale: To provide investors with clear information on the interest rate and credit risk profile of debt schemes, enabling informed investment decisions and risk awareness.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure Regarding Perpetual Bonds in Debt Schemes
content.checklist_description: AMCs must disclose in the SID that the placement of the scheme in the PRC matrix does not reflect holdings in perpetual bonds with respect to Macaulay Duration and maturity thresholds for pre-existing holdings as of June 7, 2021. Fresh investments in perpetual bonds are permitted only in schemes classified as Class III (any Macaulay Duration).
content.rationale: To clarify the treatment of perpetual bonds in risk classification and ensure investors are aware of exceptions in risk measurement.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investment in Securities Excluded from Associate Definition
content.checklist_description: AMCs must disclose scheme-wise investments, as of the last day of each quarter, in securities of entities excluded from the definition of 'associate'. The disclosure must include ISIN-wise value of investments and their percentage of the scheme’s AUM. This information must be published on the AMC’s website and AMFI’s website within one month from the quarter-end.
content.rationale: To enhance transparency regarding investments in entities related to the AMC or sponsor, ensuring investors are informed about potential conflicts or related party exposures.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Change in Control of AMC to Unitholders
content.checklist_description: In the event of a change in control of the AMC, the mutual fund must disclose to unitholders (via email or letter) and publish an advertisement in newspapers detailing: (a) activities and financial track record of the new sponsor, (b) condensed financial information of schemes if taken over by an existing mutual fund, and (c) amount and procedure for claiming unclaimed redemptions and dividends. Unitholders must be given an exit option at prevailing NAV without exit load for at least 30 calendar days from communication date. The SID and other offer documents must be revised and updated accordingly.
content.rationale: To ensure unitholders are fully informed about significant changes in AMC control and their rights, maintaining investor protection and transparency.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Nomination Option and Process
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose in the SID the option for investors subscribing on or after October 1, 2022, to either provide a nomination using the format specified in the Fourth Schedule of SEBI (Mutual Funds) Regulations or opt out of nomination via a signed declaration form. The AMC must provide both physical and online modes for submission, with online submissions validated through e-Sign or two-factor authentication. Existing individual unitholders must be given a deadline (June 30, 2024) to comply, failing which folios will be frozen for debits. AMCs and RTAs must communicate regularly to encourage compliance.
content.rationale: To standardize nomination practices, enhance investor protection, and ensure clarity on succession and transmission of units.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investment and Advisory Services to Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs)
content.checklist_description: AMCs must disclose in the SID if they provide management and advisory services to FPIs falling under specified categories (government-related investors, appropriately regulated entities, or FPIs with majority ownership by such entities), including those operating from International Financial Services Centres (IFSC) regulated by IFSCA. Restrictions on investments by FPIs not falling under specified categories, such as prohibition on contra-positions in equity and derivatives for six months, must also be disclosed.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the AMC’s client base and regulatory compliance related to foreign investments, ensuring transparency on investment restrictions and AMC services.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investment in Minor’s Name through Guardian and Transmission Process
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose that investments made in the name of a minor through a guardian will accept payments only from bank accounts of the minor, parent, or guardian. Redemption proceeds will be credited only to the verified bank account of the minor. Upon attaining majority, the minor must update KYC and bank details before further transactions. The AMC must suspend systematic investment/transfer/withdrawal plans upon minor attaining majority until status is updated. The transmission process must be disclosed, including the use of image-based processing, common forms, uniform document requirements, and prohibition on redemption requests pending transmission completion.
content.rationale: To ensure investor protection and clarity in handling investments made on behalf of minors and streamline transmission of units.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Product Label and PRC Matrix Placement in Advertisements
content.checklist_description: The product label (including Risk-o-meter) and the Potential Risk Class matrix with the scheme’s placement must be displayed prominently and visibly in all scheme advertisements by the mutual fund and its distributors.
content.rationale: To ensure consistent and prominent communication of scheme risk profiles to investors across all promotional materials.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Accounting Standards Compliance
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose that financial statements and accounts of schemes are prepared in accordance with Indian Accounting Standards (IND AS) effective April 1, 2023. They must provide opening balance sheets as per IND AS and disclose perspective historical per unit statistics for the past 3 years, labeling previous GAAP information as not IND AS compliant and describing the nature of adjustments required for IND AS compliance.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and comparability of financial information in line with updated accounting standards.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Networth Computation Format
content.checklist_description: The SID or related documents must disclose the format for networth computation of the AMC, detailing paid-up capital, share premium, free reserves, and deductions such as miscellaneous expenditure, accumulated losses, intangible assets, and minimum capital adequacy requirements under other SEBI regulations.
content.rationale: To provide clarity on the financial strength and regulatory compliance of the AMC managing the mutual fund schemes.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Exit Period for Unitholders
content.checklist_description: Wherever an exit option is provided to unitholders under MF Regulations and circulars, the SID must disclose that unitholders will be given a minimum exit period of 30 calendar days to exercise the exit option.
content.rationale: To standardize exit timelines across schemes and ensure investors have sufficient time to make exit decisions.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Fund's Risk Profile and Investment Strategies
content.checklist_description: The Scheme Information Document (SID) must clearly disclose the mutual fund scheme's risk profile or risk appetite, including the investment strategies and risk factors associated with the scheme. It should also incorporate any other elements of risk appetite as stipulated by the AMC and Trustees.
content.rationale: Investment risk management should be based on reasonable investor expectations about the risks the mutual fund will take to achieve its investment objectives, and this must be communicated transparently to investors.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investment Universe and Policies
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose the investment universe, updated periodically, and clearly define the policies related to investments in various asset classes/securities permitted by SEBI. This includes policies on hedging interest rate risk, foreign exchange risk, price risk, participation in IPOs/FPOs (including those of associate/group companies), trade execution, trade allocation, inter-scheme transfers, investment valuation, and broker empanelment.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and adherence to regulatory requirements, investors must be informed about the scope and policies governing the scheme's investments.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Risk Management Framework and Limits
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the risk management framework including limits set for issuer/sector exposure vis-à-vis the benchmark, limits for investments in debt and money market instruments of various credit qualities, and any internal limits imposed by the AMC. It should also mention the use of risk metrics such as Risk-O-Meter and Potential Risk Class (PRC) vis-à-vis the scheme benchmark.
content.rationale: To provide investors with an understanding of how investment risks are controlled and monitored within regulatory and internal limits.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Credit Risk Management Policies
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose the AMC's credit risk management policy, including the process of analysis and evaluation of credit ratings from multiple agencies, in-house credit assessment procedures, early warning signals for credit deterioration, and concentration limits (counterparty, group, sector, geography).
content.rationale: Credit risk is a key risk for debt and money market instruments, and investors must be informed about the measures taken to manage this risk.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Liquidity Risk Management Approach
content.checklist_description: The SID must describe the liquidity risk management model used by the AMC, including how secondary market liquidity is incorporated, classification of assets into maturity buckets, modelling of liabilities based on historical subscription and redemption data, and any alerts for asset-liability mismatches.
content.rationale: Liquidity risk affects the ability to meet redemption requests and impacts scheme stability; hence, disclosure ensures investor awareness of liquidity management.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investment Restrictions and Compliance
content.checklist_description: The SID should clearly state the investment restrictions applicable to the scheme as per SEBI regulations and internal policies, including limits on sector, issuer, and instrument types, and the process for monitoring and managing breaches and exceptions.
content.rationale: To ensure that the scheme operates within regulatory boundaries and investors are aware of the controls in place to maintain compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Risk Mitigation and Control Measures
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose the risk mitigation strategies and control mechanisms implemented by the AMC, including stress testing, scenario analysis, and corrective actions taken in case of risk breaches or adverse events.
content.rationale: Investors need to understand how the AMC proactively manages and mitigates risks to protect their interests.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Governance and Risk Management Roles
content.checklist_description: The SID should provide information about the governance structure related to risk management, including the roles and responsibilities of the AMC's Board, Trustees, Chief Risk Officer (CRO), Chief Investment Officer (CIO), other CXOs, and Fund Managers in managing risks.
content.rationale: Transparency in governance and accountability enhances investor confidence in the fund's risk management practices.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Risk Reporting and Monitoring Mechanisms
content.checklist_description: The SID should explain the risk reporting framework, including frequency of risk reporting to the Board and Trustees, types of risk metrics reported, and how emerging risks and material risk incidents are escalated and addressed.
content.rationale: Regular and structured risk reporting ensures ongoing oversight and timely management of risks, which is critical for investor protection.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Performance and Risk Metrics
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose quantitative risk measures and performance metrics used by the AMC such as Value at Risk (VaR), Sharpe Ratio, Treynor Ratio, Information Ratio, redemption and investor concentration analysis, and stress testing results.
content.rationale: Providing these metrics helps investors assess the risk-return profile of the scheme and make informed investment decisions.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Policies on Inter-Scheme Transfers and Trade Allocation
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose the policies governing trade allocation and inter-scheme transfers, including adherence to these policies and mechanisms to identify allocations that deviate from normal percentage allocations across funds.
content.rationale: To ensure fairness and transparency in the allocation of investment opportunities among schemes managed by the AMC.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investment Due Diligence for Inter-Scheme Transfers
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose that in cases of inter-scheme transfers, the scheme buying the securities conducts an enhanced level of due diligence before investment.
content.rationale: Enhanced due diligence protects investors from potential risks arising from inter-scheme transactions.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Liquidity Risk Associated with the Scheme
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the liquidity risk associated with the scheme/product, including factors such as the ability to liquidate assets near their ascribed value within a specified period, and the forward-looking asset-liability mismatch over at least the next 30 days.
content.rationale: SEBI mandates systematic classification and evaluation of liquidity risks to ensure investors are informed about potential liquidity constraints and the AMC's approach to managing such risks.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Asset-Liability Mismatch Limits and Management Policy
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose the AMC's policy on managing asset-liability mismatches, including the upper limits or thresholds set for mismatches customized by scheme size or type, the alert mechanisms in place, and reporting frequency to the Board and SEBI.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency on how the AMC manages liquidity and redemption risks arising from mismatches between putative liabilities and liquid assets.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Stress Testing Policy and Results
content.checklist_description: The SID must include details of the stress testing policy, including risk parameters used, methodology adopted, procedures to handle stress events and early warning signals, and a summary of stress test results conducted at least monthly (excluding close-ended and interval schemes).
content.rationale: Stress testing is mandated by SEBI to assess the scheme's resilience to market shocks and liquidity pressures, ensuring investor awareness of potential risks.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Governance Risk Management Policy
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose the AMC's approved policy to manage governance risks of investee companies, including assessment of governance structures, track record of issuers, conflict of interest monitoring involving Board/KMP members, and adherence to SEBI's Stewardship Code.
content.rationale: Governance risk can materially impact investment performance; disclosure ensures investors understand how the AMC monitors and mitigates such risks.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Operational Risk Management Framework
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the operational risk management policy covering governance structure, identification and management of operational risk events, escalation and reporting mechanisms, guidelines on transactions with related parties, and communication protocols with external stakeholders.
content.rationale: Operational risks can lead to financial loss and reputational damage; disclosure promotes transparency on controls and risk mitigation.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Compliance Risk Management Policies
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose policies addressing regulatory compliance including KYC, AML/CFT, outsourcing, investor grievance redressal, related party transactions, conflict of interest, insider trading prevention, and all disclosure requirements including derivatives and contingent liabilities.
content.rationale: Compliance risk management is critical to protect investors and maintain regulatory adherence; disclosure informs investors of the AMC's commitment to compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Combating Financing of Terrorism (CFT) Program
content.checklist_description: The SID must describe the AML/CFT program attributes such as employee awareness, transaction monitoring for suspicious activities, reporting mechanisms to authorities, and training programs.
content.rationale: To ensure investors are aware of the AMC's efforts to prevent money laundering and terrorism financing risks.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Technology, Information Security and Cyber Risk Management
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose the cyber security and cyber resilience framework including governance, identification and classification of critical IT assets, access controls, physical security, network security, data encryption, patch management, and incident response procedures.
content.rationale: Given the reliance on technology, disclosure of cyber risk management assures investors of the AMC's preparedness against cyber threats.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Reputation and Conduct Risk Management
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the AMC's approach to managing reputation and conduct risks, including integration into business strategy, crisis management policies, social media grievance monitoring, and enforcement of codes of ethics and business conduct.
content.rationale: Reputation and conduct risks can affect investor confidence and fund performance; disclosure promotes transparency on risk mitigation.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Outsourcing Risk Management Policy
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose the AMC's Board-approved outsourcing policy detailing core activities not outsourced, risk and materiality assessment procedures, monitoring and control mechanisms, selection criteria, service level agreements, incident reporting, and periodic review of service providers.
content.rationale: Outsourcing involves fiduciary responsibilities; disclosure ensures investors understand how risks from third-party service providers are managed.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Sales and Distribution Risk Management
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose measures to manage sales and distribution risks including performance appraisal linked to mis-selling risk, responsibility for distributor conduct, certification requirements (e.g., NISM certification), commission structures, audit procedures, and due diligence of distributors.
content.rationale: To protect investors from mis-selling and ensure transparency in distribution practices.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Financial Reporting Risk Controls
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose the AMC's accounting policies and procedures for mutual fund accounting, segregation of duties within finance functions, and documentation and testing of internal controls over financial reporting.
content.rationale: Accurate financial reporting is essential for investor trust and regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Legal and Tax Risk Management Processes
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose documented processes and responsibilities for statutory levy calculations and deposits, acceptance of applications from permitted jurisdictions, monitoring and redressal of tax risks, review and execution of material legal agreements, and maintenance of centralized legal registers.
content.rationale: Legal and tax risks can materially impact fund operations; disclosure ensures investor awareness of risk mitigation.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Talent Risk Management and Succession Planning
content.checklist_description: The SID should disclose policies and procedures for recruiting qualified staff, screening processes including background checks, succession planning for key positions, and ensuring availability of adequate backups for key personnel.
content.rationale: Talent risk affects fund management quality; disclosure assures investors of continuity and expertise.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Distributor Certification Requirements
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose that all sales staff and distributors are required to be NISM certified or hold equivalent valid certifications as prescribed by SEBI/AMFI.
content.rationale: Certification ensures distributor competence and protects investors from unqualified advice.

content.checklist_title: Risk-o-Meter Disclosure
content.checklist_description: The Scheme Information Document (SID) must disclose the risk level of the scheme using the SEBI prescribed Risk-o-Meter methodology. This includes the risk value calculated based on credit risk, interest rate risk, liquidity risk for debt securities; market capitalization, volatility, and impact cost for equity securities; and appropriate risk values for derivatives, REITs, InvITs, commodities, foreign securities, and mutual fund schemes held. The risk level must be mapped to the defined risk categories (Low, Low to Moderate, Moderate, Moderately High, High, Very High) and depicted clearly in the SID.
content.rationale: SEBI Circular SEBI/HO/IMD/DF3/CIR/P/2020/197 dated October 05, 2020 mandates uniform risk evaluation and disclosure to enable investors to understand the risk profile of mutual fund schemes transparently.

content.checklist_title: Detailed Risk Parameters for Debt Securities
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the methodology for evaluating credit risk, interest rate risk (using Macaulay Duration), and liquidity risk of debt securities in the portfolio. It should specify how credit ratings are mapped to risk values, how Macaulay Duration is used for interest rate risk, and how liquidity risk is assessed based on listing status, credit rating, and instrument structure. The weighted average risk values and the final risk value calculation method must be explained.
content.rationale: This ensures investors are informed about the specific risks associated with debt instruments in the scheme, as per SEBI Circular SEBI/HO/IMD/DF3/CIR/P/2020/197.

content.checklist_title: Risk Parameters for Equity Securities
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the risk evaluation methodology for equity securities based on market capitalization (large cap, mid cap, small cap), volatility (based on past two years' daily price volatility), and liquidity (impact cost over last three months). It should explain how weighted averages are computed and how IPO or recently listed securities are treated in risk calculations.
content.rationale: To provide investors with a clear understanding of the equity risk profile of the scheme, facilitating informed investment decisions, as mandated by SEBI Circular SEBI/HO/IMD/DF3/CIR/P/2020/197.

content.checklist_title: Risk Evaluation for Derivative Instruments
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the risk assessment approach for derivative instruments including index futures, stock futures, index options, stock options, and other derivatives. It should clarify treatment of hedging positions, the volatility values assigned, and the calculation of weighted average risk values for derivatives in the portfolio.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency about the risk contribution of derivatives in the scheme portfolio, aligning with SEBI's risk disclosure framework.

content.checklist_title: Risk Disclosure for REITs, InvITs, Commodities, and Foreign Securities
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the assigned risk values for investments in REITs and InvITs (value 7), commodities like gold and silver based on annualized volatility, and foreign securities (value 7). The methodology for calculating weighted average risk values for these asset classes must be included.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the specific risk profiles of alternative asset classes within the scheme, as per SEBI Circulars SEBI/HO/IMD/DF3/CIR/P/2020/197 and SEBI/HO/IMD/IMD-II DOF3/P/CIR/2022/49.

content.checklist_title: Risk Disclosure for Investments in Other Mutual Fund Schemes
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the risk values assigned to investments in other mutual fund schemes based on their risk-o-meter categories (Low to Very High) and for overseas mutual fund units or ETFs (value 7). The weighted average risk value calculation methodology must be explained.
content.rationale: To provide clarity on the risk implications of investing in units of other mutual funds, ensuring comprehensive risk disclosure.

content.checklist_title: Cash and Net Current Assets Risk Disclosure
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose that cash and net current assets are assigned a risk value of 1 (Low) in the risk-o-meter calculation.
content.rationale: To accurately reflect the low risk associated with cash holdings in the scheme portfolio.

content.checklist_title: Illustrative Examples of Risk-o-Meter Calculation
content.checklist_description: The SID should include illustrative examples demonstrating the calculation of risk-o-meter values for typical debt and equity schemes, showing the weighted average calculations of risk parameters and final risk level determination.
content.rationale: To enhance investor understanding of the risk evaluation process and the resulting risk-o-meter classification.

content.checklist_title: Risk-o-Meter Disclosure
content.checklist_description: The Scheme Information Document (SID) must disclose the risk-o-meter rating of the scheme, indicating the risk level (e.g., Very High Risk, High Risk) based on the weighted average risk value of the portfolio. The risk-o-meter should be depicted visually and explained with reference to the methodology used for calculation.
content.rationale: To provide investors with a clear understanding of the risk profile of the scheme, enabling informed investment decisions.

content.checklist_title: Stewardship Policy Disclosure
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the mutual fund's comprehensive stewardship policy, including how it monitors and engages with investee companies on performance, governance, ESG risks, and other material matters. It should also include policies on conflict of interest management, intervention in investee companies, voting policies, and periodic reporting on stewardship activities.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency about the fund's active role in corporate governance and responsible investment practices, thereby protecting investor interests.

content.checklist_title: Conflict of Interest Policy
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the policy for identifying and managing conflicts of interest in fulfilling stewardship responsibilities. This includes procedures such as blanket bans on certain investments, segregation of voting and client relations functions, recusal policies, and maintenance of records of decisions taken.
content.rationale: To assure investors that conflicts of interest are managed diligently and that client interests are prioritized.

content.checklist_title: Monitoring and Intervention Policy
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the policy on continuous monitoring of investee companies, specifying levels and areas of monitoring (e.g., financial performance, governance, ESG risks), and the policy on intervention including circumstances and mechanisms for active engagement or escalation.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the fund’s approach to oversight and active management of investee companies to safeguard their investments.

content.checklist_title: Voting Policy and Disclosure
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the voting policy including mechanisms of voting (e-voting, proxy), guidelines for decision-making on resolutions, use of proxy advisors, conflict of interest management in voting, and disclosure of voting activity with rationale and periodicity (e.g., quarterly on website).
content.rationale: To enhance transparency and accountability in exercising voting rights, thereby improving governance of investee companies.

content.checklist_title: Periodic Stewardship Reporting
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the commitment to periodic reporting on stewardship activities to clients/beneficiaries, including the format, frequency (e.g., quarterly, annual), and channels of disclosure (e.g., website, annual reports).
content.rationale: To keep investors informed about how stewardship responsibilities are being fulfilled, fostering trust and confidence.

content.checklist_title: Nomination Opt-Out Declaration
content.checklist_description: The SID must provide a declaration form for investors opting out of nomination, explaining the implications and the requirement for legal heirs to submit requisite documents in case of the investor's death.
content.rationale: To ensure investors are aware of the consequences of not appointing a nominee and the procedural requirements thereafter.

content.checklist_title: Minimum Disclosure Requirements for Schemes
content.checklist_description: The SID must include minimum disclosures such as Mutual Fund name and website link, scheme name, type and category, fund manager name, investment objective, scheme performance with source, scheme details (minimum investment, AUM, NAV, exit load, expense ratio), risk-o-meter and potential risk matrix, and other mandatory disclosures as specified by SEBI.
content.rationale: To provide investors with standardized, essential information for evaluating and comparing mutual fund schemes.

content.checklist_title: ESG and Investment Strategy Disclosure
content.checklist_description: For schemes employing ESG or sustainability strategies, the SID must disclose details of the strategy including exclusion criteria, integration of ESG factors, best-in-class screening, impact investing objectives, sustainable objectives, transition investments, and the methodology used to assess and monitor environmental, social, and governance impacts.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the ESG approach and impact objectives of the scheme, enabling alignment with investor values and regulatory expectations.

content.checklist_title: Unit Holder Protection Committee (UHPC) Details
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the constitution, membership criteria (including minimum independent directors), meeting frequency, quorum requirements, powers, responsibilities, and reporting mechanisms of the Unit Holder Protection Committee responsible for safeguarding investor interests.
content.rationale: To assure investors of a dedicated governance mechanism focused on protecting their rights and addressing grievances.

content.checklist_title: Unit Holder Protection Metrics and Reporting
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the internal policies for measurement and reporting of unit holder protection metrics such as investor complaints, fraud incidents, scheme underperformance, transaction turnaround times, system issues, and data privacy incidents, including targeted benchmarks and periodic review mechanisms.
content.rationale: To demonstrate the fund’s commitment to monitoring and improving investor protection standards.

content.checklist_title: Purchase Pricing Policy for Debt Securities
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the indicative factors and methodology for determining the purchase price of corporate debt securities, including valuation policies, yield mark-ups, spread considerations, qualitative factors, and approval and review processes by the Board of Trustees and Investment Committee.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency in pricing practices for debt securities, safeguarding investor interests and ensuring fair valuation.

content.checklist_title: Loss Waterfall Accounting Framework
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the loss absorption mechanism for schemes investing in CDMDF units, detailing the classes of units (A1, A2, A3), their roles in loss absorption, NAV adjustments, allocation of profits and losses, and manual intervention processes required for accounting and NAV calculations.
content.rationale: To provide clarity on risk-sharing and accounting treatment during market dislocations, ensuring investor understanding of potential impacts.

content.checklist_title: New Scheme Reporting Requirements
content.checklist_description: The SID or associated disclosures must include details of new schemes such as scheme name, type, opening and closing dates, subscription details (number of applicants, amounts), expenses incurred, allotment date, listing details, unit holding pattern, and communication to unitholders regarding large holdings.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency and regulatory compliance regarding new scheme launches and investor participation.

content.checklist_title: Key Personnel and Director Bio-Data Disclosure
content.checklist_description: The SID or accompanying documents must disclose detailed bio-data of directors and key personnel including identification details, educational qualifications, employment history, relationship with sponsor or AMC, regulatory or criminal violations, and declarations affirming accuracy and compliance with SEBI regulations.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency about the qualifications and integrity of individuals managing the mutual fund, fostering investor confidence.

content.checklist_title: Geographical Dispersion of Unit Holders
content.checklist_description: Disclose the state-wise geographical dispersion of unit holders in the specified format, including the mode of entry (Direct/Broker), number of unit holders, and amount mobilised as a percentage of total assets mobilised. Also disclose the total number of cities from which subscriptions have been received.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on the distribution and reach of the mutual fund's investor base, enabling assessment of investor diversification and market penetration.

content.checklist_title: Details of Top Ten Agents/Distributors
content.checklist_description: List the names of the top ten agents/distributors in descending order of commission paid, along with the amount mobilised (in Rs. Crore) and commission paid (in Rs. Crore).
content.rationale: To disclose the key intermediaries responsible for mobilising funds and the commission structure, ensuring transparency in distribution expenses.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Utilisation of Sponsor or Associates for Securities Transactions
content.checklist_description: If the asset management company (AMC) has utilised the services of the sponsor or any of its associates, employees, or their relatives for securities transactions and distribution, disclose this fact to unit holders and disclose the brokerage or commission paid in the half yearly and annual accounts of the mutual fund.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency regarding potential conflicts of interest and related party transactions affecting unit holders.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Underwriting Obligations and Investments Related to Associate Companies
content.checklist_description: Disclose in the half yearly and yearly accounts any underwriting obligations taken by the scheme in respect of issues of securities of associate companies, devolvement if any, subscription in issues lead managed by associate companies, and subscription to any issue of equity or debt on private placement basis where the sponsor or its associate companies acted as arranger or manager.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on the scheme's exposure and obligations related to associate companies, highlighting potential conflicts and risk concentrations.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investments Exceeding 5% of Net Asset Value in a Company
content.checklist_description: Disclose in the half yearly and annual accounts the details of investments where any company has invested more than 5% of the net asset value of a scheme, including investments made by that scheme or any other scheme of the same mutual fund in that company or its subsidiaries, along with justification for such investment.
content.rationale: To inform investors about significant concentration risks and ensure justification for large exposures within schemes.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Transactions in Securities by Key Personnel and Directors
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of transactions in securities by key personnel and directors of the AMC in their own name or on behalf of the AMC on a quarterly basis to the trustees.
content.rationale: To monitor and disclose potential insider trading or conflicts of interest involving key personnel.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of AMC's Net Worth and Business Activities
content.checklist_description: Disclose that the AMC's net worth is computed as per regulatory definitions and maintained continuously above prescribed thresholds. Also disclose that the AMC is not acting as trustee and is not undertaking any business activities other than management and advisory services related to pooled assets, subject to conditions specified by SEBI.
content.rationale: To assure investors of the AMC's financial stability and focus on regulated activities, reducing conflict of interest.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investment Valuation Norms and Practices
content.checklist_description: Disclose that the AMC computes and carries out valuation of investments in accordance with the investment valuation norms specified in the Eighth Schedule and publishes the same. Also disclose any instances where prices provided by valuation agencies were not considered, with justifications.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and fairness in valuation practices affecting NAV computation.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Sponsor or AMC Investment in the Scheme
content.checklist_description: Disclose that the sponsor or AMC has invested not less than one percent of the amount raised in the new fund offer or fifty lakh rupees, whichever is less, in the scheme option specified by SEBI, and that such investment shall not be redeemed unless the scheme is wound up.
content.rationale: To demonstrate the sponsor's or AMC's commitment and alignment of interest with unit holders.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Nomination Facility to Unit Holders
content.checklist_description: Disclose that the AMC provides an option to unit holders to nominate a person in whom the units held shall vest in the event of the unit holder's death, as specified in the Fourth Schedule.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the nomination facility for succession planning.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Advertisement Compliance
content.checklist_description: Disclose that all advertisements conform to the Advertisement Code specified in the Sixth Schedule, are submitted to SEBI within 7 days from the date of issue, and comply with relevant clauses and master circular provisions.
content.rationale: To ensure that promotional materials are fair, non-misleading, and compliant with regulatory standards.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Benchmark Returns and Performance Review
content.checklist_description: Disclose benchmark returns and periodic review of scheme performance by the Boards of AMC and Trustees.
content.rationale: To provide investors with a basis for evaluating scheme performance relative to benchmarks.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Risk Management Framework
content.checklist_description: Disclose the risk management systems in place covering fund management, operations, customer service, market and distribution, disaster recovery, and business contingency, including specific restrictions for liquid and overnight funds.
content.rationale: To assure investors of robust risk management practices safeguarding their investments.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investment Restrictions and Compliance
content.checklist_description: Disclose compliance with investment restrictions including single issuer limits, ownership limits, inter-scheme transfers, investments in unlisted/unrated securities, sector and group exposures, borrowings, loans, and investments in associate/group companies as per SEBI regulations and master circular.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency on adherence to regulatory investment limits and risk controls.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investor Services Compliance
content.checklist_description: Disclose compliance with investor servicing timelines such as transfer of unit certificates within 30 days, dispatch of dividend payments within 15 days, repurchase/redemption proceeds within 10 working days, and payment of interest for delays, along with details of investor complaints and their resolution status.
content.rationale: To maintain investor confidence through timely servicing and transparent complaint handling.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Half-Yearly Trustee Report Summary
content.checklist_description: Disclose a summary of the half-yearly trustee report covering scheme performance, AMC activities, compliance with investment restrictions, valuation and pricing practices, listing status, dispatch timelines, dealings with associates, appointment of key personnel and registrars, broker empanelment, related party transactions, and other compliance matters as specified by SEBI.
content.rationale: To provide investors with an independent oversight report ensuring AMC and scheme compliance with regulations and protection of unitholder interests.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Monthly Cumulative Report Data
content.checklist_description: Disclose monthly cumulative data including number of schemes and folios, funds mobilised, repurchase/redemption amounts, net inflow/outflow, net assets under management, average net assets, number of segregated portfolios, and net assets under segregated portfolios, categorized by scheme types.
content.rationale: To provide ongoing transparency on fund flows and scheme size for investor information and regulatory monitoring.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Overseas Investments
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of overseas investments including amount invested, redemption value, and valuation in Indian Rupees and US Dollars across instruments such as ADR/GDR, equity of overseas companies, foreign debt securities, government securities of AAA rated countries, overseas ETFs, and units/securities issued by overseas mutual funds, along with the number of schemes investing overseas.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on foreign exposure and currency risk to investors.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Unitholding Pattern as on March 31
content.checklist_description: Disclose the unitholding pattern of the mutual fund as on March 31 each year, categorized by Individuals, NRIs/OCBs, FPIs, Corporate/Institutions/Others, including number of folios and net asset value, aggregated for all schemes.
content.rationale: To inform investors and regulators about the investor base composition and concentration.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Daily Transaction Report Submission
content.checklist_description: Disclose that the mutual fund submits daily transaction reports to SEBI in the prescribed format, covering total purchases and sales of equity and debt securities, with unique transaction IDs, and procedures for amendments or deletions of reported transactions.
content.rationale: To enable SEBI to monitor trading activities and detect irregularities or non-compliance in real time.

content.checklist_title: Details of Live Schemes
content.checklist_description: Disclose the number of live schemes as on the last day of the quarter, categorized by type (Open ended, Close ended, Interval) and further by scheme categories such as Overnight/Liquid/Money Market Funds, Gilt Funds, Debt Schemes (assured and non-assured), Infrastructure Debt Funds, ELSS, Equity Schemes, Hybrid Schemes, Solution Oriented Schemes, Other Schemes including ETFs, and Fund of Funds (Domestic and Overseas).
content.rationale: To provide trustees and investors with a clear snapshot of the mutual fund's active scheme portfolio and its composition as per SEBI reporting requirements.

content.checklist_title: Details of Schemes Launched During the Quarter
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of schemes launched during the quarter including those launched but not constituted, specifying scheme name, category as per MCR, type (Open/Closed/Interval), launch date, closing date, allotment date, subscription received (INR Cr.), and number of folios for both Direct and Regular plans.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency on new scheme launches and subscription status for investor awareness and regulatory oversight.

content.checklist_title: Details of Schemes Matured or Wound Up
content.checklist_description: Provide details of schemes matured or wound up during the quarter including scheme name, category, type, amount redeemed at maturity/winding up, number of unit-holders, and maturity/pay-out date. For wound-up schemes, payout details should be provided quarterly until the last payout.
content.rationale: To inform stakeholders about scheme closures and redemption details ensuring accountability and investor protection.

content.checklist_title: Details of Scheme Mergers
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of schemes merged during the quarter including merging scheme and surviving scheme names, categories, types, effective date of merger, and exit period (30 days from and to dates).
content.rationale: To maintain transparency on scheme consolidations and investor exit options as per SEBI guidelines.

content.checklist_title: Details of Close-ended Schemes Rolled-over
content.checklist_description: Provide details of close-ended schemes rolled over during the quarter including scheme name, category, original maturity date, date of roll-over, period of roll-over, extended maturity date, and amount rolled over (INR Cr.).
content.rationale: To disclose scheme maturity extensions and associated financial details for investor information and compliance.

content.checklist_title: Details of Fundamental Attribute Changes
content.checklist_description: Disclose schemes that underwent fundamental attribute changes during the quarter specifying scheme name, category, type, effective date of change, and description of the change.
content.rationale: To inform investors and trustees about significant changes affecting scheme characteristics as mandated by SEBI.

content.checklist_title: SEBI Clearance for New Schemes
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of SEBI clearance received for launching new schemes during the quarter including scheme name, category, type, SEBI clearance date, and validity of clearance.
content.rationale: To confirm regulatory approval for new schemes ensuring compliance with SEBI regulations.

content.checklist_title: Assets Under Management (AUM) Details
content.checklist_description: Provide scheme-wise details of AUM including scheme name, category, number of folios, AUM as on last day of previous quarter, total inflow and outflow during the quarter, and AUM as on last day of current quarter (all in INR Cr.).
content.rationale: To provide a clear picture of fund size and investor participation for each scheme as part of regular reporting.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on AMC's Other Permissible Activities
content.checklist_description: Disclose whether other activities of the AMC are as per MF Regulations, confirm net worth requirements for each activity, explain performance differences exceeding 10% between schemes managed by the same fund manager and other activities, and confirm such disclosures are also made on the AMC's website.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency on AMC's activities and potential conflicts, safeguarding investor interests.

content.checklist_title: Net Worth of AMC and Conflict of Interest
content.checklist_description: Disclose the net worth of the AMC, its deployment, and confirm absence of conflict of interest in deployment. Also provide confirmation of compliance with guidelines on conflicts of interest of intermediaries and related persons.
content.rationale: To assure investors of financial stability and ethical conduct of AMC operations.

content.checklist_title: Changes in AMC Directors and Their Interests
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of any changes in AMC directors and their interests during the quarter.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency on governance and potential conflicts at the AMC level.

content.checklist_title: Transactions in Securities by AMC Key Personnel
content.checklist_description: Provide details of securities transactions by key AMC personnel in their own name or on behalf of AMC including names, security details, purchase/sale quantity, rate, value, broker name, and whether transaction is personal, family, or fiduciary. Confirm compliance with guidelines on employee investments and reporting of violations.
content.rationale: To prevent insider trading and ensure ethical conduct by AMC personnel.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Proxy Voting by Mutual Funds
content.checklist_description: Disclose that AMC has voted on all resolutions, with rationale for vote decisions recorded prudently and adequately.
content.rationale: To ensure accountability and transparency in proxy voting practices.

content.checklist_title: Compliance on Cyber Security and Cyber Resilience
content.checklist_description: Provide status of compliance with Cyber Security and Cyber Resilience framework applicable to Mutual Funds and AMCs.
content.rationale: To safeguard investor data and fund operations against cyber threats.

content.checklist_title: Regulatory Actions and Corrective Measures
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of all regulatory actions initiated or taken during the quarter including enforcement proceedings, warnings, deficiencies from SEBI or other regulators, and corrective actions taken.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency on regulatory compliance and remedial efforts.

content.checklist_title: Availability and Format of Offer Documents
content.checklist_description: Confirm adoption of SEBI specified formats for Scheme Information Document (SID) and Key Information Memorandum (KIM), and ensure ready availability of offer documents (SID, KIM, SAI) with distributors, Investor Service Centres, and on the AMC website.
content.rationale: To ensure investors have easy access to standardized and complete scheme information.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure for Capital Protection Oriented Schemes
content.checklist_description: Disclose in offer documents the structure and continuous monitoring of Capital Protection Oriented Schemes including quarterly review of ratings.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the risk mitigation and monitoring mechanisms of such schemes.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure for Guaranteed Return Schemes
content.checklist_description: Disclose in offer documents the name of the person guaranteeing returns, the manner of guarantee fulfillment, and confirm ability to honor guaranteed commitments. No guaranteed returns should be offered unless fully guaranteed by sponsor or AMC.
content.rationale: To protect investors from misleading guarantees and ensure accountability.

content.checklist_title: Performance Disclosure with Benchmarks
content.checklist_description: Disclose scheme performance vis-à-vis assigned appropriate benchmarks for periods of 1, 3, 5, 10 years and since allotment date, including additional benchmarks if any.
content.rationale: To provide investors with comparative performance data for informed decisions.

content.checklist_title: Investment Compliance and Exposure Disclosures
content.checklist_description: Disclose confirmation that investments comply with MF Regulations, Trust Deed, and investment objectives. Provide details of exposure across schemes towards individual issuers, group companies, sectors, and equity investments exceeding 10% of paid-up capital including purchase date, company name, price, value, holding percentage, association with sponsor/AMC, and justification.
content.rationale: To ensure regulatory compliance and transparency on concentration risks.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Intended and Actual Portfolio Allocation
content.checklist_description: Disclose intended portfolio allocation and actual portfolio for close-ended debt-oriented schemes launched during the quarter.
content.rationale: To inform investors about adherence to stated investment plans.

content.checklist_title: Inter-scheme Investment Details
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of inter-scheme investments during the quarter including scheme names, investment date, price, value, and charges levied if any.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency on transactions between schemes within the mutual fund.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Investments in Unlisted and Privately Placed Securities
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of investments in unlisted and privately placed securities during the quarter including performance and due diligence exercised. Confirm compliance with regulatory requirements on such investments and their valuation.
content.rationale: To ensure investor awareness and regulatory compliance on less liquid investments.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Investments in Unrated Debt Instruments
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of investments in unrated debt instruments during the quarter along with due diligence details and confirmation of compliance with regulatory valuation norms.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on credit risk and valuation practices.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Downgraded or Defaulted Investments
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of investments downgraded below investment grade or defaulted during the quarter along with comments on steps taken or planned by the AMC.
content.rationale: To inform investors about credit quality deterioration and AMC’s risk management.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Overseas Investments
content.checklist_description: Disclose due diligence, risk-return analysis, and investor interest justification for overseas investments. For overseas mutual fund schemes, disclose management fees and expenses charged by underlying and investing schemes. Confirm compliance with regulatory requirements on such investments and valuations.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and compliance on cross-border investments.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Parking of Funds in Short Term Deposits
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of funds parked in short-term deposits of Scheduled Commercial Banks pending deployment during the quarter and confirm compliance with MF Regulations and circulars on such parking.
content.rationale: To ensure proper use of investor funds and regulatory adherence.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Participation in Repo, CDS, REIT, InvIT, Commodity Derivatives
content.checklist_description: Confirm and disclose that participation in repo on corporate debt securities, Credit Default Swaps, REITs, InvITs, commodity derivatives, etc. was in compliance with regulatory requirements and in the interest of investors.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency on complex financial instruments and compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Carry Forward Transactions
content.checklist_description: Confirm that scheme funds are not used for carry forward transactions. Disclose details of any transactions resulting in carry forward including date, scrip, broker, rate, and quantity.
content.rationale: To prevent misuse of scheme funds and ensure regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Securities Lending
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of securities lending during the quarter including value, volume, intermediaries, earnings/losses, collateral value, and confirm that lending is not detrimental to unit-holders.
content.rationale: To provide transparency and safeguard investor interests in securities lending.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Borrowings by Mutual Fund Schemes
content.checklist_description: Disclose borrowing details during the quarter including date, nature, source, amount, purpose, interest rate, security, borrowing percentage to net assets, repayment date or liquidation manner, amount borne by scheme and AMC, and average portfolio yield. If borrowing is from associate entities, provide reasons and competitiveness of terms.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and justification of borrowings impacting schemes.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Inter-Scheme Transfers (ISTs)
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of ISTs during the quarter including dates, transferor and transferee schemes, securities transferred, price, value, and specific reasons for transfer.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency on internal scheme transactions.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure on Cross Investments
content.checklist_description: If any company has invested more than 5% of a scheme’s NAV, disclose details of investments made by that scheme or other schemes of the mutual fund in that company or its subsidiaries within one year, with justification.
content.rationale: To disclose potential concentration and related party investments.

content.checklist_title: Code of Conduct Compliance for Fund Managers and Dealers
content.checklist_description: Confirm compliance with the code of conduct specified for fund managers and dealers under MF Regulations during the quarter.
content.rationale: To ensure ethical standards and regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Valuation of Investments
content.checklist_description: Confirm valuation of all debt and money market instruments complies with regulatory requirements. Report justification for deviations from indicative haircuts or valuation prices for below investment grade securities.
