Confirm valuation follows norms in Eighth Schedule of MF Regulations with periodic reviews by AMC and statutory auditors. Confirm communication of changes in security terms to valuation agencies.
content.rationale: To ensure accurate and compliant valuation of scheme assets.

content.checklist_title: Trade Execution and Allocation Compliance
content.checklist_description: Confirm compliance with SEBI regulatory requirements on trade execution and allocation. Report any non-compliance or material information to trustees.
content.rationale: To maintain fairness and transparency in trade practices.

content.checklist_title: Risk Management Framework Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Disclose outcomes of the risk management framework for mutual funds and steps taken to address issues. Confirm compliance with regulatory requirements ensuring investor protection.
content.rationale: To demonstrate effective risk oversight.

content.checklist_title: Stress Testing Outcomes
content.checklist_description: Disclose outcomes of stress testing of open-ended mutual fund schemes and steps taken to address identified risks.
content.rationale: To inform on resilience of schemes under stress scenarios.

content.checklist_title: Broker Empanelment and Transaction Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Confirm AMC has not dealt with associate brokers for ≥5% of aggregate purchases/sales over three months. If dealing with non-associate brokers ≥5%, disclose justification, transaction dates, broker names, business value, brokerage paid, percentage of business, and association status. Confirm due diligence in empanelment and monitoring to avoid undue concentration.
content.rationale: To prevent conflicts of interest and ensure fair broker selection.

content.checklist_title: Scheme-wise Segregation of Assets and Liabilities
content.checklist_description: Confirm that assets, liabilities, bank accounts, and securities accounts of each scheme are segregated and ring-fenced from other schemes.
content.rationale: To protect scheme assets and ensure clear accounting.

content.checklist_title: Identification and Appropriation of Expenses
content.checklist_description: Confirm all scheme-related expenses including distributor commissions are paid from the scheme within regulatory limits and not from AMC or associates. If expenses are paid from AMC books, confirm compliance with limits (2 bps), proper recording, and audit.
content.rationale: To ensure proper expense charging and investor protection.

content.checklist_title: Maintenance of Books of Accounts and Records
content.checklist_description: Confirm proper maintenance of books, records, and documents for each scheme and inform SEBI of their location.
content.rationale: To ensure regulatory compliance and audit readiness.

content.checklist_title: Reconciliation of Investments in Government Securities
content.checklist_description: Confirm monthly reconciliation of Government securities balances in SGL/CSGL accounts with RBI statements, submission of quarterly compliance certificates to RBI, and inclusion of reconciliation in internal audit and audit committee reports.
content.rationale: To ensure accuracy and integrity of government securities holdings.

content.checklist_title: Investor Holding and Concentration Limits
content.checklist_description: Confirm compliance with minimum 20 investors per scheme and no single investor holding more than 25% of scheme net assets during the quarter.
content.rationale: To ensure diversification and reduce concentration risk.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Large Investments by Companies
content.checklist_description: Disclose names of companies investing more than 5% of scheme NAV and their association with sponsor or AMC, if any.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on significant investors and potential related party influence.

content.checklist_title: Uniform Cut-off Timings for NAV Applicability
content.checklist_description: Confirm compliance with uniform cut-off timings for NAV applicability. Provide details of manual time stamping instances with justification and steps taken to prevent recurrence. List any seal damages or electronic time stamping breakdowns.
content.rationale: To ensure fair treatment of investor transactions.

content.checklist_title: Timely Dispatch of Redemption Proceeds and Unit Transfers
content.checklist_description: Confirm all redemption and dividend payments are made within regulatory timelines. In case of delay, confirm payment of interest to unitholders at SEBI specified rates.
content.rationale: To protect investor interests and ensure timely payments.

content.checklist_title: Investor Complaints Status
content.checklist_description: Provide status of investor complaints received through various modes including number received, redressed, pending with ageing analysis (0-3, 4-7, 8-20, 21-40, 41-60, beyond 60 days) and reasons for pending complaints.
content.rationale: To demonstrate effective grievance redressal and transparency.

content.checklist_title: KYC and AML Compliance
content.checklist_description: Confirm compliance with regulatory requirements for Know Your Customer (KYC) norms and Anti-Money Laundering/Countering Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT) obligations under PMLA and related rules.
content.rationale: To prevent financial crimes and ensure regulatory adherence.

content.checklist_title: Consent of Unitholders
content.checklist_description: Confirm that wherever required, consent of unitholders was obtained during the quarter as per MF Regulations.
content.rationale: To ensure investor approval for material changes.

content.checklist_title: Distributor Empanelment Details
content.checklist_description: Disclose number of new distributors empanelled during the quarter with lists of domestic, overseas, and new cadre distributors. Confirm withholding of commission for distributors with expired ARN. Confirm due diligence for fit and proper criteria during empanelment and review.
content.rationale: To ensure quality and compliance in distributor network.

content.checklist_title: Certification and Registration of Intermediaries
content.checklist_description: Confirm that distributors and AMC employees engaged in selling/distribution have required certifications. Confirm no brokerage paid on brokers' own investments. Confirm monitoring of intermediaries to prevent malpractice and reporting of non-compliance to AMFI and SEBI.
content.rationale: To maintain ethical distribution practices.

content.checklist_title: No Communication of Indicative Portfolio or Yield
content.checklist_description: Confirm that no indicative portfolio or indicative yield has been communicated by mutual funds or distributors in any manner.
content.rationale: To avoid misleading investors with non-binding projections.

content.checklist_title: Service Contracts Review and Compliance
content.checklist_description: Confirm review of all service contracts (custody, transfer agency) to ensure execution in unitholders' interest. Confirm all service providers hold appropriate SEBI or regulatory registrations. Confirm proper protection, holding, and administration of trust property by adequate persons as per Regulation 18(25)A.
content.rationale: To ensure service quality and regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Independent Directors' Specific Attention
content.checklist_description: Confirm that independent directors have given specific attention to areas under Regulation 18(27) and provide details of comments to trustees.
content.rationale: To enhance governance and oversight.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Special Developments
content.checklist_description: Disclose any special developments in the mutual fund during the quarter to trustees.
content.rationale: To keep trustees informed of material events.

content.checklist_title: Associate Transactions Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Disclose utilization of sponsor or associates' services for securities transactions and distribution, brokerage and commission paid, details of underwriting obligations, subscriptions in issues lead managed by associates, subscriptions on private placement basis involving associates, investments in associate companies, securities transactions with associates as counterparties, purchase/sale of securities of sponsor/group/associates with justification, confirmation of no investment in unlisted/privately placed securities of associates, and investments/redemptions by AMC, sponsor, associates in schemes during the quarter.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and prevent conflicts of interest in related party transactions.

content.checklist_title: Treatment of Corporate Actions
content.checklist_description: Disclose classification of corporate actions as involuntary or voluntary, treatment of such actions (e.g., buy-back considered as sale), and compliance status of RGESS demat accounts in involuntary actions.
content.rationale: To clarify handling of corporate actions affecting investor holdings.

content.checklist_title: Overseas Investments Reporting Format
content.checklist_description: Disclose overseas investments in prescribed format including mutual fund name, scheme, intended investment (USD mn), NFO completion date, 6-month completion date, limit utilized as at month end, and unutilized balance amount for both NFOs and ongoing schemes.
content.rationale: To ensure standardized reporting and monitoring of overseas exposures.

content.checklist_title: Half Yearly Financial Results Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Disclose half yearly financial results for each scheme including unit capital, reserves & surplus, total net assets, NAV, dividend paid, income (dividend, interest, profit/loss on sales), expenses (commission, management fees, trustee fees), returns (half-yearly and compounded annualized), provisions, payments to associates, investments in associates, and notes on accounting policy changes, related party transactions, large holdings, bonuses, borrowings, derivative exposures, and benchmark performance.
content.rationale: To provide comprehensive financial performance and position details for investor information and regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Abridged Scheme-wise Annual Report Format
content.checklist_description: Disclose abridged annual report including auditor's report, scheme performance and outlook, background of sponsors, trust, trustee and AMC, investment objectives, significant accounting policies, unclaimed dividends and redemptions, statutory information on sponsor liability, price and redemption value risks, availability of full annual report and trust deed, and trustee company details.
content.rationale: To provide investors with summarized but essential information on scheme operations and governance.

content.checklist_title: Abridged Balance Sheet and Revenue Account
content.checklist_description: Disclose abridged balance sheet and revenue account for each scheme with detailed classification of liabilities, assets (including investments by type and listing status), income, expenses, net gains/losses, unrealized appreciation/depreciation, dividend appropriation, and notes to accounts including investments registered in trustee name, derivatives positions, transactions with associates, large holdings, unit capital movement, contingent liabilities, and prior year comparisons.
content.rationale: To ensure transparent financial reporting and compliance with SEBI requirements.

content.checklist_title: Monthly and Half Yearly Portfolio Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Disclose portfolio details including name of instrument, quantity, market value, percentage to NAV for equity (listed/unlisted), debt instruments (listed/unlisted), securitized debt, money market instruments, interest rate derivatives, and others. Include derivative positions (futures, options, swaps) with details on underlying, contract prices, margin, exposure percentages, number of contracts, gross notional values, and net profit/loss. Provide footnotes on defaulted securities, illiquid securities, NAV at period start/end, outstanding derivative exposure, foreign securities investments, portfolio turnover ratio, industry classification, average maturity period, and funds parked in short term deposits with bank details and percentages.
content.rationale: To provide detailed and transparent disclosure of scheme portfolios and derivative exposures for investor protection.

content.checklist_title: Monthly Average Assets Under Management (AAUM) Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Disclose monthly AAUM by scheme category and scheme name, segregated by investor category (retail, corporates, banks/FIs, FIIs/FPIs, HNIs), city classification (Top 30 cities and others), and mode of investment (direct plan, associate distributors, non-associate distributors). Also disclose state-wise/union territory-wise contribution to AUM by scheme category.
content.rationale: To provide granular data on fund size and investor demographics for regulatory monitoring and investor information.

content.checklist_title: Scheme Name and Type
content.checklist_description: Disclose the name and type of the scheme aligned with SEBI circulars on categorization and rationalization of mutual fund schemes. For close-ended or target maturity schemes, maturity/duration must be mentioned in the scheme name. For index funds/ETFs, the complete name of the underlying index must be included. For feeder funds, the complete name of the underlying fund must be included in the scheme name.
content.rationale: To ensure clarity and consistency in scheme identification and to avoid misleading investors by aligning scheme names with regulatory categorization and product characteristics.

content.checklist_title: Product Labelling and Risk-o-meter
content.checklist_description: Disclose product labelling including the Scheme Risk-o-meter and Benchmark Risk-o-meter as per AMFI Tier 1 benchmark. The labelling assigned during NFO should be based on internal assessment and investors should be informed that it may vary post-NFO.
content.rationale: To provide investors with a clear understanding of the risk profile of the scheme and benchmark for informed investment decisions.

content.checklist_title: Offer Details and Entity Information
content.checklist_description: Disclose the New Fund Offer (NFO) open and close dates, scheme re-opening date, face value of units, names and addresses of Mutual Fund, AMC, Trustee Company, and their websites. Include a due diligence certificate from AMC and a disclaimer that SEBI has neither approved nor certified the accuracy of the SID.
content.rationale: To provide transparency about the offer period, responsible entities, and regulatory status, enabling investors to verify and understand the scheme's legitimacy.

content.checklist_title: Investment Objective
content.checklist_description: State a clear and concise investment objective that is true to the scheme label. Include the mandatory statement: 'There is no assurance that the investment objective of the Scheme will be achieved.'
content.rationale: To set realistic expectations and inform investors about the scheme’s goals and associated risks.

content.checklist_title: Scheme Category and Type
content.checklist_description: Disclose the category of the scheme as per SEBI categorization circulars. For debt schemes, include the Potential Risk Class (PRC) description and table in the scheme type disclosure.
content.rationale: To facilitate investor understanding of the scheme’s classification and risk profile.

content.checklist_title: Liquidity and Listing Details
content.checklist_description: Provide details of liquidity provisions on an ongoing basis. If the scheme is listed or proposed to be listed (e.g., ETFs, close-ended schemes), disclose listing details including the stock exchange and scrip code.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the ease of entry and exit and secondary market availability.

content.checklist_title: Benchmark Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Disclose the AMFI Tier 1 benchmark and justification specific to the scheme objective for the use of the benchmark index. If applicable, disclose a second-tier benchmark.
content.rationale: To enable investors to compare scheme performance against an appropriate and relevant benchmark.

content.checklist_title: NAV Disclosure Timings
content.checklist_description: Mention the daily NAV disclosure timings on AMFI and AMC websites. Further details should be provided in Section II of the SID.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and timely availability of NAV information to investors.

content.checklist_title: Applicable Timelines for Transactions
content.checklist_description: Disclose timelines for dispatch of redemption proceeds and Income Distribution cum Capital Withdrawal (IDCW) payments, if applicable.
content.rationale: To set investor expectations regarding receipt of funds and income distributions.

content.checklist_title: Plans and Options
content.checklist_description: Disclose available plans (Direct Plan, Regular Plan) and options under each plan (Growth, IDCW including facilities and default options). Detailed disclosures on default plans and options should be referenced to the SAI.
content.rationale: To inform investors about investment choices and features available under the scheme.

content.checklist_title: Load Structure
content.checklist_description: Disclose the exit load structure applicable to the scheme, specifying the percentage of NAV charged as exit load. Refer investors to AMC website or distributors for current load details.
content.rationale: To inform investors about costs associated with exiting the scheme.

content.checklist_title: Minimum Application and Redemption Amounts
content.checklist_description: Disclose minimum application amounts during NFO and continuous offer, minimum additional purchase amount, and minimum redemption/switch-out amounts. Mention any minimum balance requirements.
content.rationale: To provide clarity on investment thresholds and facilitate investor planning.

content.checklist_title: New Fund Offer Period and Price
content.checklist_description: Disclose NFO open and close dates (minimum 3 working days, maximum 15 days), and the price per unit during NFO. For ELSS schemes, NFO period governed by Government guidelines.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the subscription window and pricing during the initial offer.

content.checklist_title: Segregated Portfolio/Side Pocketing Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Provide a confirmation or disclosure statement regarding segregated portfolio or side pocketing. Refer investors to SAI for detailed information.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the scheme’s approach to handling illiquid or non-performing assets.

content.checklist_title: Swing Pricing Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Provide a confirmation or disclosure statement regarding swing pricing. Refer investors to SAI for detailed information.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the scheme’s policy on adjusting NAV to mitigate dilution costs.

content.checklist_title: Stock Lending and Short Selling Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Provide a confirmation or disclosure statement regarding stock lending and short selling activities. Refer investors to SAI for detailed information.
content.rationale: To disclose additional investment practices that may impact scheme risk and returns.

content.checklist_title: Application Process Summary
content.checklist_description: Provide a summary of the application process for subscription, redemption, and switches. Detailed procedures should be referenced in Section II.
content.rationale: To guide investors on how to transact in the scheme.

content.checklist_title: Investor Services Contact Details
content.checklist_description: Disclose contact details for general service requests and complaint resolution.
content.rationale: To facilitate investor communication and grievance redressal.

content.checklist_title: Specific Scheme Attributes
content.checklist_description: Disclose specific attributes such as lock-in period, duration for target maturity or close-ended schemes, as applicable.
content.rationale: To inform investors about scheme-specific features affecting investment horizon and liquidity.

content.checklist_title: Special Products/Facilities Available
content.checklist_description: Briefly describe special products or facilities available during NFO and ongoing basis, such as Systematic Investment Plan (SIP), Systematic Transfer Plan (STP), and Systematic Withdrawal Plan (SWP). Refer to SAI for details.
content.rationale: To inform investors about additional investment options and convenience features.

content.checklist_title: Weblink for TER and Scheme Factsheet
content.checklist_description: Provide a weblink where the Total Expense Ratio (TER) for the last 6 months and the scheme factsheet are made available.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency on expenses and scheme performance.

content.checklist_title: Asset Allocation and Indicative Exposure
content.checklist_description: Disclose an asset allocation table showing broad classification of assets with indicative minimum and maximum percentage exposures. Include details on investments in overseas securities, derivatives, stock lending, securitized debt, AT1/AT2 bonds, ReITs/InVITs, tri-party repos, mutual funds, CDS, covered call options, etc. Provide negative confirmation for asset classes not intended for investment. Disclose cumulative gross exposure limits and reference applicable SEBI circulars.
content.rationale: To provide investors with a clear understanding of the scheme’s investment pattern and risk exposures.

content.checklist_title: Investment Instruments Description
content.checklist_description: Provide a detailed list and description of all instruments in which the scheme will invest, including definitions and applicable regulations. For overseas investments, disclose compliance with SEBI and RBI requirements.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the nature and scope of the scheme’s investments.

content.checklist_title: Investment Strategies
content.checklist_description: Disclose the investment approach and risk control measures in simple terms. Specify whether the strategy is passive or active. Discuss the probable effect of investment strategies on portfolio turnover rate and related consequences such as brokerage and transaction costs. Provide summary disclosure on derivatives strategies and refer to SAI for detailed information.
content.rationale: To enable investors to understand how the scheme intends to manage investments and associated risks.

content.checklist_title: Benchmarking Methodology
content.checklist_description: Disclose the benchmark (Total Returns Index) used for performance comparison, including the name and justification specific to the scheme objective.
content.rationale: To provide a relevant performance yardstick for investors.

content.checklist_title: Fund Manager Details
content.checklist_description: Disclose the name, age, educational qualifications, and last 10 years of experience of the fund manager managing the scheme. Include names of other schemes managed by the fund manager. Dedicated fund managers are mandatory for commodity-based funds and overseas investments.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on the expertise and experience of the person managing investors’ funds.

content.checklist_title: Scheme Differentiation
content.checklist_description: Provide a reference list of existing schemes of the mutual fund and a functional website link containing a detailed comparative table showing how the scheme differs from existing schemes.
content.rationale: To help investors understand the unique features and positioning of the scheme.

content.checklist_title: Scheme Performance Disclosure
content.checklist_description: For existing schemes, disclose compounded annualized returns for the last 1, 3, and 5 years and since inception, along with benchmark returns. For schemes less than 1 year old, disclose absolute returns since inception. For new schemes without performance history, state that no performance track record exists. Represent absolute returns for last 5 financial years via bar diagram.
content.rationale: To provide investors with historical performance data for informed decision-making.

content.checklist_title: Additional Scheme Related Disclosures
content.checklist_description: Disclose scheme’s portfolio holdings (top 10 holdings by issuer and sector allocation) via a functional website link. For debt and equity ETFs/index funds, disclose name and exposure to top 7 issuers, stocks, groups, and sectors as a percentage of NAV via a website link. Disclose portfolio turnover rate, particularly for equity-oriented schemes. Disclose aggregate investment in the scheme by fund managers and AMC directors, including NAV per unit. Disclose AMC investments in the scheme via a website link and confirm that AMC shall not charge fees on such investments.
content.rationale: To enhance transparency regarding portfolio composition, concentration risks, and related party investments.

content.checklist_title: Computation of NAV
content.checklist_description: Disclose the methodology for computation of NAV, including illustration of sale and repurchase price calculation. State that repurchase price shall not be lower than 95% of NAV. Refer to SAI for policies on NAV computation, rounding off, foreign securities investment, and procedures in case of delay in NAV disclosure.
content.rationale: To provide clarity on valuation and pricing mechanisms affecting investors.

content.checklist_title: New Fund Offer Expenses
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of expenses incurred during NFO such as sales and distribution fees, marketing, registrar expenses, printing, and bank charges. State the source of meeting these expenses and confirm that no NFO expenses will be charged to the scheme.
content.rationale: To inform investors about costs associated with launching the scheme and ensure no undue burden on the scheme.

content.checklist_title: Annual Recurring Expenses
content.checklist_description: Disclose estimated annual recurring expenses as a percentage of daily average net assets, with slab-wise breakup based on assets under management and plan/option-wise differences. Provide detailed breakup of expense heads including management fees, audit fees, custodial fees, registrar fees, marketing expenses, investor communication, brokerage, GST, and other expenses as per Regulation 52 of SEBI MF Regulations. For Fund of Funds schemes, disclose that investors bear expenses of underlying schemes in addition to the scheme’s expenses.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on ongoing costs impacting investor returns.

content.checklist_title: Load Structure Details
content.checklist_description: Disclose the exit load structure as a percentage of NAV, noting that load amounts are variable and subject to change. Refer investors to AMC website or distributors for current applicable load structure.
content.rationale: To inform investors about exit costs and facilitate cost comparison.

content.checklist_title: Section II - Risk Factors and Mitigation
content.checklist_description: Disclose scheme-specific risk factors including those associated with investment instruments as indicated in asset allocation. Include risk mitigation strategies employed by the scheme.
content.rationale: To inform investors of potential risks and how the scheme manages them.

content.checklist_title: Investment Restrictions
content.checklist_description: Disclose all investment restrictions applicable to the scheme as per the Seventh Schedule to SEBI (Mutual Funds) Regulations, 1996 and circulars issued thereunder. If the AMC follows internal exposure limits beyond regulatory restrictions, disclose these as well.
content.rationale: To ensure compliance and inform investors of limits on scheme investments.

content.checklist_title: Fundamental Attributes of the Scheme
content.checklist_description: Disclose fundamental attributes including type of scheme (open-ended, close-ended, interval), category (sectoral, equity, balanced, income, index, etc.), investment objective (growth, income, or both), and tentative portfolio break-up with minimum and maximum asset allocation. Mention the option to alter asset allocation temporarily for defensive considerations.
content.rationale: To provide investors with core information defining the scheme’s nature and investment approach.

content.checklist_title: Terms of Issue
content.checklist_description: Disclose liquidity provisions such as listing, repurchase, redemption terms; aggregate fees and expenses charged to the scheme; and any safety net or guarantee provided.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the terms governing their investment and associated costs.

content.checklist_title: Change in Fundamental Attributes
content.checklist_description: Disclose that no change in fundamental attributes, fees, or other material scheme features shall be made without SEBI review and comments, written communication to unitholders, advertisement in newspapers, and providing unitholders at least 30 calendar days to exit at prevailing NAV without exit load.
content.rationale: To protect investor interests by ensuring transparency and exit options before material changes.

content.checklist_title: Index Methodology for Index Funds/ETFs
content.checklist_description: Disclose details regarding the index, including eligibility criteria, methodology, index service provider, constituents, and impact cost of constituents.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on the benchmark underlying index for passive schemes.

content.checklist_title: Incentive Structure for Market Makers (ETFs)
content.checklist_description: Disclose principles of incentive structure for market makers involved in ETFs.
content.rationale: To inform investors about mechanisms ensuring liquidity and market efficiency.

content.checklist_title: Floors and Ceilings for Close-Ended Debt Schemes
content.checklist_description: Disclose floors and ceilings within a range of 5% of intended allocation against each subclass of asset as per SEBI master circular clause 13.6.2 for close-ended debt schemes.
content.rationale: To provide clarity on permissible asset allocation ranges for close-ended debt schemes.

content.checklist_title: Other Scheme Specific Disclosures
content.checklist_description: Disclose listing and transfer of units, dematerialization of units, minimum target amount (with refund conditions if not collected), maximum amount to be raised, dividend policy (IDCW), allotment procedure and timelines, refund policy with interest for delays, eligibility criteria for investors, application procedures, submission points, reissue policy for repurchased units, restrictions on unit retention or disposal, cut-off timings for transactions, mandatory bank account details for redemption, minimum balance requirements and consequences, account statement dispatch timelines, consolidated account statement issuance, dividend/IDCW payment timelines, redemption proceeds dispatch timelines, bank mandate details, delay interest liability for AMC, unclaimed redemption and IDCW disclosures, investment by minors, and other disclosures as per consolidated checklist.
content.rationale: To comprehensively inform investors about operational, procedural, and regulatory aspects affecting their investments.

content.checklist_title: Fund of Funds Scheme Disclosures
content.checklist_description: For Fund of Funds schemes, disclose benchmark, investment objective, investment strategy, TER, AUM, year-wise performance, and top 10 holdings or provide a link to top 10 holdings of the underlying fund.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on the underlying investments and performance metrics.

content.checklist_title: Periodic Disclosures
content.checklist_description: Specify timelines and details for periodic disclosures such as half-yearly results, annual reports, and other mandated disclosures. Provide functional links to AMC website, SAI, AMFI website, and other relevant sources.
content.rationale: To ensure investors have timely access to updated scheme information.

content.checklist_title: Transparency and NAV Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Provide detailed disclosures on transparency and NAV as referenced in Section I.
content.rationale: To maintain investor confidence through transparent valuation practices.

content.checklist_title: Transaction Charges and Stamp Duty
content.checklist_description: Indicate the amount of transaction charges and stamp duty applicable to the scheme. Detailed information should be provided in the SAI.
content.rationale: To inform investors about additional costs associated with transactions.

content.checklist_title: Associate Transactions
content.checklist_description: Refer investors to the Statement of Additional Information (SAI) for disclosures related to associate transactions.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency regarding related party dealings.

content.checklist_title: Taxation Details
content.checklist_description: Provide a summary of taxation applicable to resident investors and mutual funds, including tax on dividend, long-term and short-term capital gains. Refer to the SAI for detailed taxation provisions.
content.rationale: To inform investors about tax implications of their investments.

content.checklist_title: Rights of Unitholders
content.checklist_description: Refer investors to the SAI for details on the rights of unitholders.
content.rationale: To ensure investors are aware of their legal rights and protections.

content.checklist_title: List of Official Points of Acceptance
content.checklist_description: Provide and maintain a functional website link listing official points of acceptance for applications, including collecting banker details.
content.rationale: To facilitate investor access to authorized transaction points.

content.checklist_title: Penalties, Litigation, and Regulatory Findings
content.checklist_description: Disclose any penalties, pending litigation or proceedings, findings of inspections or investigations by regulatory authorities, and actions taken or in process. Ensure real-time updating of this information on a functional website link.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency regarding the AMC’s regulatory compliance and legal standing.

content.checklist_title: Financial Statements and Notes Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Disclose scheme-wise balance sheet and revenue account as per Indian Accounting Standards (IND AS), including detailed notes on assets, liabilities, income, expenses, and accounting policies. Include disclosures on defaulted securities, contingent liabilities, valuation policies, and signatories responsible for financial statements. Disclose total income and expenditure as a percentage of average net assets at plan level.
content.rationale: To provide comprehensive financial information ensuring transparency and accountability.

content.checklist_title: Half-Yearly Consolidated Account Statement
content.checklist_description: Disclose a half-yearly consolidated account statement containing details such as ISIN, scheme name, folio number, number of units, NAV, cumulative amount invested, market value, average total expense ratio, and gross commission paid to distributors for both regular and direct plans.
content.rationale: To provide investors with consolidated transactional and holding information for better tracking and transparency.

content.checklist_title: Overseas Investment Proposal Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of overseas investments including amount proposed in ADRs/GDRs/foreign securities/overseas ETFs, schemes through which investments are proposed, consistency with investment objectives, disclosure of attendant risks in offer documents, bank branch details for foreign currency transactions, and details of overseas service providers including custodians and specialized agencies with information on services, fees, regulatory compliance, and experience. Include declarations by AMC and Trustees regarding due diligence and adequacy of systems.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and regulatory compliance for overseas investments, safeguarding investor interests.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Sponsor, AMC and Trustee Details
content.checklist_description: Disclose the constitution of the Mutual Fund including date of trust formation, registration details, name and contribution of the Sponsor, details of the Trustee company and its directors with age, qualifications and brief experience, and details of the Asset Management Company (AMC) including its incorporation date, registered office, directors, and key personnel with their qualifications and experience.
content.rationale: To provide transparency about the entities managing the Mutual Fund and their credentials, ensuring investor confidence and regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Service Providers
content.checklist_description: Provide names, addresses, and SEBI registration numbers of key service providers such as Custodian, Registrars and Transfer Agents (RTAs), Statutory Auditors, Legal Counsel, Fund Accountant, and Collecting Bankers. Include a statement ensuring the Registrar has adequate capacity to process applications and handle investor complaints within prescribed timelines.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the entities involved in scheme operations and assure them of the capability and regulatory compliance of these service providers.

content.checklist_title: Condensed Financial Information (CFI) of Schemes
content.checklist_description: Disclose historical per unit statistics for all schemes launched in the last three fiscal years (excluding redeemed schemes), including NAV at the beginning and end of the year, dividends declared (excluding liquid schemes), annualized returns for growth options, net assets at period end, and ratio of recurring expenses to net assets. Provide explanations if annualized returns are not given for options other than growth and absolute returns for schemes less than one year.
content.rationale: To provide investors with a concise financial performance overview of the schemes managed by the Mutual Fund.

content.checklist_title: Application Procedure and KYC Requirements
content.checklist_description: Describe the manner in which units of the scheme can be purchased, emphasizing the procedures to be followed by prospective investors. Include details of KYC requirements for unit holders.
content.rationale: To guide investors on the subscription process and ensure compliance with regulatory KYC norms.

content.checklist_title: Rights of Unitholders
content.checklist_description: Disclose the rights of unitholders including proportionate beneficial ownership, timelines for dispatch of dividend warrants (within 30 days), account statements (within 10 business days of redemption/switch), unit certificates (within 30 days upon request), redemption proceeds (within 10 business days), disclosure obligations of Trustees regarding material adverse information, conditions for termination of AMC, scheme wind-up procedures, and requirements for unitholder consent for fundamental changes including communication and exit options without exit load.
content.rationale: To protect investor interests by clearly outlining their rights and the Mutual Fund’s obligations.

content.checklist_title: Investment Valuation Norms
content.checklist_description: Disclose the valuation norms for securities and other assets of the scheme in accordance with the Eighth Schedule of Regulation 47 of SEBI (Mutual Funds) Regulations, 1996 and applicable guidelines. For Real Estate Mutual Fund Schemes, disclose valuation norms as per Schedule IXB of Regulation 49(F)(1).
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and uniformity in asset valuation, enabling investors to understand how scheme assets are valued.

content.checklist_title: Taxation, Legal and General Information
content.checklist_description: Disclose applicable tax provisions for the Mutual Fund and investments in the scheme. Include legal information such as nomination facility, KYC requirements, Prevention of Money Laundering Act compliance, transfer and transmission of units, scheme duration and winding up procedures. Also disclose policies on inter-scheme transfers, associate transactions including underwriting obligations, brokerage commissions, investments in group companies, and dealings with associates including commissions paid.
content.rationale: To provide investors with comprehensive information on tax implications, legal framework, and related party transactions affecting the scheme.

content.checklist_title: Documents Available for Inspection
content.checklist_description: List documents available for inspection at the Mutual Fund office during business hours, including Memorandum and Articles of Association of AMC, Investment Management Agreement, Trust Deed and amendments, Mutual Fund Registration Certificate, agreements with Custodian and RTAs, consents of Auditors and Legal Advisors, SEBI (Mutual Funds) Regulations and Indian Trusts Act.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency and allow investors to verify key legal and operational documents.

content.checklist_title: Investor Grievance Redressal Mechanism
content.checklist_description: Briefly describe the investor complaints history for the last three fiscal years of existing schemes and the redressal mechanism. Include data updated every two months on the number of complaints received, resolved, and pending with the Mutual Fund.
content.rationale: To assure investors of the Mutual Fund’s commitment to addressing grievances effectively.

content.checklist_title: Scheme Suitability and Product Labeling
content.checklist_description: Specify the scheme’s suitability to investors and disclose product labeling based on the level of risk associated with the scheme.
content.rationale: To help investors assess whether the scheme aligns with their risk appetite and investment objectives.

content.checklist_title: Scheme Offer Details
content.checklist_description: Disclose the offer price per unit during New Fund Offer (NFO) and NAV-based prices upon reopening, NFO open and close dates, and scheme reopening date for continuous sale and repurchase.
content.rationale: To provide clarity on subscription pricing and timelines.

content.checklist_title: Investment Objective and Asset Allocation
content.checklist_description: Clearly state the investment objective of the scheme and provide the asset allocation pattern with types of instruments, normal allocation percentages, and risk profile.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the scheme’s goals and investment strategy.

content.checklist_title: Risk Factors
content.checklist_description: Disclose all general and scheme-specific risk factors at a single place in the SID, including risks related to infrastructure sector investments, equities, bonds, bank deposits, convertibles, securitized debt, unrated securities, derivatives, and stock lending/short selling if applicable.
content.rationale: To ensure investors are fully informed of potential risks before investing.

content.checklist_title: Plans, Options and NAV Applicability
content.checklist_description: Disclose the plans and options available under the scheme and specify the applicable NAV for purchase and redemption after the scheme opens for continuous sale and repurchase.
content.rationale: To provide clarity on investment choices and pricing.

content.checklist_title: Minimum Application Amount and Load Structure
content.checklist_description: Disclose minimum application amounts for purchase, additional purchase, and repurchase. Provide detailed load structure including entry load, exit load, and contingent deferred sales charge (CDSC) for NFO and continuous offer periods. Mention waiver of load for direct applications and applicable procedures.
content.rationale: To inform investors of the financial commitments and charges involved.

content.checklist_title: Benchmark Index
content.checklist_description: Disclose the benchmark index or indices against which the scheme’s performance will be compared and provide justification for the choice.
content.rationale: To enable investors to evaluate scheme performance relative to an appropriate benchmark.

content.checklist_title: Fund Manager Details
content.checklist_description: Disclose the name, age, qualification, and experience (including last 10 years and other schemes managed) of the fund manager responsible for the scheme.
content.rationale: To provide investors with information about the expertise managing their investments.

content.checklist_title: Investment Restrictions
content.checklist_description: Incorporate all investment restrictions applicable under SEBI (Mutual Funds) Regulations and any internal norms followed by the fund regarding exposure limits to particular securities or sectors.
content.rationale: To ensure compliance and inform investors of constraints on scheme investments.

content.checklist_title: Scheme Performance Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Provide past performance data of the scheme including returns over specified periods, with appropriate disclaimers and benchmark comparisons.
content.rationale: To help investors assess historical performance while understanding that past returns do not guarantee future results.

content.checklist_title: Indicative Portfolio and Ratings
content.checklist_description: Disclose indicative percentage allocation to various securities with credit ratings at the time of investment, considering the most conservative rating in case of dual ratings.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the expected composition and credit quality of the portfolio.

content.checklist_title: Valuation Policy
content.checklist_description: Provide a detailed valuation policy for scheme assets based on fair valuation principles and conducted in good faith.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and consistency in asset valuation.

content.checklist_title: Extension of Scheme Tenure
content.checklist_description: Disclose conditions and regulatory provisions related to extension in the tenure of the scheme.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the possibility and terms of scheme tenure extension.

content.checklist_title: Placement Details for Private Placement Schemes
content.checklist_description: Disclose placement period dates, offer price per unit, minimum application amount, minimum target amount, details of strategic investors, plans/options offered, dividend policy, allotment and refund timelines, investor eligibility, listing details, mandatory bank mandate and PAN quoting, pledge/lien details, capital commitments, subsequent drawdowns, default penalties, and restrictions on unit disposal.
content.rationale: To provide comprehensive information for investors in privately placed schemes.

content.checklist_title: Periodic Disclosures
content.checklist_description: Disclose frequency and mode of Net Asset Value (NAV) publication, portfolio disclosures, half-yearly results, annual reports, and general tax information advising investors to consult tax advisors.
content.rationale: To keep investors informed about scheme performance and regulatory disclosures.

content.checklist_title: Computation of NAV
content.checklist_description: Describe the policies and methodology for computation of NAV in accordance with SEBI regulations, including rounding off policies.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and consistency in NAV calculation.

content.checklist_title: Fees and Expenses Disclosure
content.checklist_description: Detail all fees and expenses charged to the scheme including placement expenses, annual recurring expenses with slab-wise break-up, brokerage and transaction costs, Goods & Service Tax (GST) treatment, additional expenses for inflows from beyond top 15 cities, and transaction charges as per SEBI circulars. Disclose that brokerage and transaction costs above prescribed limits are borne by AMC/trustees/sponsors.
content.rationale: To provide investors with a clear understanding of the cost structure impacting their investments.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Penalties and Pending Litigations
content.checklist_description: Disclose any penalties, pending litigations, proceedings, or findings of inspections or investigations involving the Mutual Fund or AMC, as per SEBI requirements.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency about regulatory or legal issues affecting the Mutual Fund.

content.checklist_title: Standard Observations Compliance
content.checklist_description: Ensure SID includes disclosures on AMC investments in schemes, consolidated risk factors, ADR/GDR and foreign securities risks, securitized debt limits, derivatives strategies and risks, stock lending/short selling risks, investment strategy notes, fundamental attributes and change procedures, benchmark indices, fund manager details, investment restrictions, debt market features, internal exposure norms, asset allocation and rebalancing policies, types of securities, load structure changes, NAV publication and pricing, statement dispatch timelines, mandatory bank account quoting, pending penalties and litigations, jurisdiction clauses, and a statement on SEBI regulations applicability. Update information 30 days before launch and provide due diligence certificates.
content.rationale: To ensure comprehensive regulatory compliance and investor protection through standardized disclosures.

content.checklist_title: SAI Disclosures on AMC and Fund Management
content.checklist_description: Disclose AMC’s other business activities with SEBI registration and conflict of interest certification, sponsor details including activities, key personnel details with qualifications and experience, investment decision procedures, trustee supervisory roles and meetings, amendment procedures to trust deed requiring SEBI and unitholder approval, AMC shareholding pattern, AMC appointment and termination conditions, dividend and redemption dispatch timelines, suspension/restriction of redemption procedures with approvals, transfer of units processing and charges, unitholder approval procedures, policy on unclaimed redemption amounts, tax benefits as per laws, jurisdiction clauses, and nomination facility details.
content.rationale: To provide detailed background and operational transparency about the AMC and Mutual Fund governance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Performance of Other Schemes Managed by Fund Manager
content.checklist_description: Provide a tabular disclosure of the fund manager’s performance across schemes managed, showing scheme returns and benchmark returns for 1, 3, and 5 year periods, including notes on number of schemes managed, selection of top and bottom schemes if more than six, and plan type for performance data.
content.rationale: To enable investors to evaluate the fund manager’s track record across different schemes.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Brokerage and Commission Paid to Associates
content.checklist_description: Disclose brokerage and commission paid to associates, related parties, or group companies of the Sponsor or AMC, including nature of association, period covered, value of transactions, brokerage/commission amounts and percentages of total transactions or brokerage paid by the fund, with separate tables for each period.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency regarding related party transactions and potential conflicts of interest.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Mutual Funds’ Role in Corporate Governance
content.checklist_description: Disclose quarterly and annual details of votes cast by Mutual Funds on investee companies’ resolutions, including meeting dates, company names, type of meetings, proposal descriptions, management recommendations, vote decisions, and reasons supporting vote decisions. Provide summary of proxy votes cast across all investee companies.
content.rationale: To demonstrate the Mutual Fund’s active role and transparency in corporate governance of investee companies.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investor Complaints
content.checklist_description: Provide detailed monthly and annual disclosures of investor complaints received, resolved, pending, and average resolution times categorized by complaint types (e.g., non-receipt of amounts, delayed payments, statement discrepancies, unauthorized transactions), including complaints received through SCORES, with trend analysis over months and years.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency on investor grievance redressal and Mutual Fund responsiveness.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Total Expense Ratio (TER)
content.checklist_description: Disclose the Base TER, additional expenses as per Regulation 52(6A)(b) and 52(6A)(c), GST, and total TER for Regular and Direct Plans with annualized percentages and explanatory notes on components and differences between plans.
content.rationale: To provide investors with clear information on the cost structure of the scheme.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Call Options Written
content.checklist_description: Disclose details of call options written including underlying, number of contracts, percentage of underlying shares, option price when sold, current option price, margin maintained, total number of contracts entered, gross notional value, and net profit/loss on contracts exercised or expired for the reporting period.
content.rationale: To inform investors about derivative exposures and associated risks.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Credit Default Swaps (CDS) Transactions
content.checklist_description: Disclose monthly and annual details of CDS transactions including counterparty details, underlying reference entity, amount, residual maturity, tenor, price/spread, premium paid, number of transactions, amount of protection bought, credit event payments received, outstanding transactions, and net income/expenses related to CDS.
content.rationale: To provide transparency on credit risk mitigation instruments used by the scheme.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Scheme Type
content.checklist_description: The Scheme Information Document (SID) must clearly disclose the type of scheme using the exact nomenclature: Close ended, Open ended, or Interval.
content.rationale: To ensure clarity and uniformity in the classification of mutual fund schemes as mandated by SEBI circulars, facilitating investor understanding and regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Security Types in Portfolio
content.checklist_description: The SID must specify the types of securities held in the scheme's portfolio using the prescribed nomenclature such as Commercial Paper, Certificate of Deposit, Corporate Bond, Debentures, Securitised Debt, Zero Coupon Bonds, AT1 Bond, Government Bonds (including State Development Loans and special purpose bonds), Treasury Bills, Cash Management Bills, Bill Rediscounting Scheme, Corporate Bond Repo, Reverse Repo, TREPS, and Others (with specification).
content.rationale: To provide investors with detailed and standardized information about the nature of securities in the portfolio, enhancing transparency and aiding informed investment decisions.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Listed Status of Securities
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the listed status of each security in the portfolio using the exact terms: Listed, Unlisted, Awaiting Listing, or Not Applicable.
content.rationale: To inform investors about the marketability and liquidity status of securities held by the scheme, as per SEBI's standardized reporting requirements.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Date Formats
content.checklist_description: All dates mentioned in the SID, including maturity dates, coupon reset dates, and other relevant dates, must be presented in the DD-MM-YYYY format.
content.rationale: To maintain consistency and avoid ambiguity in date representation across all mutual fund documents as per SEBI guidelines.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Pricing Details for Debt Securities
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the clean price per 100 Rupees for debt securities up to at least six decimal places. For Zero Coupon Bonds, the dirty price per 100 Rupees must be disclosed. Additionally, the traded yield should be disclosed in percentage terms up to at least four decimal places. For securities already held by the scheme, the yield at which the security was valued on the previous day’s NAV must be disclosed; for first-time purchases, the yield at which the security was valued at the end of the day’s NAV must be disclosed.
content.rationale: To ensure precise and transparent disclosure of valuation metrics for debt securities, enabling investors to understand the pricing and yield basis of portfolio holdings.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Inter Scheme Transfer Details
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the nature of inter scheme transfers (IST) including whether the transfer was Primary, Secondary through market, Secondary through off-market, Buyback, or Other (with specification). For ISTs, declarations must be included stating that the transfer is in the interest of unit holders, the quality of securities is not suspect (no adverse news or credit alerts in last four months), and that the fund manager of the transferee scheme has conducted and documented a full credit risk assessment before acquisition.
content.rationale: To maintain transparency and investor protection by disclosing the rationale and due diligence involved in inter scheme transfers, as mandated by SEBI circulars.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investor Grievance Redressal Contact
content.checklist_description: The SID must provide the name and contact details of the designated Investor Relations Officer or contact person responsible for handling investor queries, complaints, or grievances. This information should also be available on the mutual fund’s website.
content.rationale: To facilitate effective communication and grievance redressal for investors, ensuring accessibility to responsible personnel as per SEBI requirements.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Rights and Responsibilities of Investors
content.checklist_description: The SID should include a section outlining the rights of investors such as the right to receive scheme information, timely account statements, NAV disclosures, annual reports, timely redemption proceeds, and grievance redressal mechanisms. It should also outline the responsibilities of investors including checking registration status, reading scheme documents, maintaining updated KYC, and investing through registered entities.
content.rationale: To educate investors about their entitlements and obligations, promoting informed investing and compliance with SEBI’s investor protection framework.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Key Service Timelines
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the expected timelines for key investor services such as issuance of Consolidated Account Statements (monthly and half-yearly), payout of redemption proceeds (within 10 days), dividend payouts (within 15 calendar days), refund of subscription money (within 5 days), and disclosure of NAV (daily by 11 pm or T+1 by 10 am for FOF schemes).
content.rationale: To set investor expectations regarding service delivery timelines and ensure compliance with SEBI’s prescribed service standards.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Portfolio and Financial Reporting Frequency
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose the frequency and timelines for portfolio disclosures (fortnightly for debt schemes within 5 calendar days, monthly within 10 calendar days, half-yearly within 10 calendar days), Risk-o-meter disclosure (by 10th of calendar day), Total Expense Ratio (TER) disclosure (daily), annual and abridged annual reports (annually before July 31), half yearly unaudited financials (within 1 month), and other relevant reports as per SEBI regulations.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and timely dissemination of scheme performance and portfolio information to investors.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Changes in Scheme Attributes and Fees
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose procedures and timelines for intimation regarding changes in Total Expense Ratio (TER) at least 3 days in advance, changes in fundamental attributes of schemes (exit window) at least 30 days prior, scheme mergers, and conversion of close-ended schemes to open-ended schemes with 30 days prior notice.
content.rationale: To protect investor interests by ensuring timely and adequate disclosure of material changes affecting the scheme.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Transactions in Debt and Money Market Securities
content.checklist_description: The SID must disclose details of all transactions in debt and money market securities within 15 days from each transaction day, including nomenclature of security type, listed status, maturity dates, pricing, yields, ratings, issuer details, and other relevant attributes as per SEBI’s prescribed reporting formats.
content.rationale: To provide investors with detailed transparency on the scheme’s debt portfolio transactions, enhancing trust and regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of AI and ML Usage in Fund Operations
content.checklist_description: If the mutual fund uses AI or ML technologies in its operations, the SID or related disclosures must include information such as SEBI registration number, entity category, application/system name, date of use, area of AI/ML application (e.g., order execution, advisory services, KYC, AML, surveillance), claims made regarding AI/ML, implementation method, controls in place, audit scope, and any adverse audit comments.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency about the use of advanced technologies affecting fund management and investor interests, in line with SEBI’s regulatory expectations.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Transaction Details for Securities
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose detailed transaction information for securities including price (clean price for debt securities), transaction value, accrued interest, statutory levies (such as STT, GST, Stamp Duty), brokerage charged, gross value, yield to maturity (for debt securities), maturity date, rating (lowest rating if multiple CRAs, including SO and CE where applicable), rating agency, broker name and association flag, counterparty name, PAN and ID, exchange where trade executed, option type (CALL/PUT for equity derivatives), and trade execution time as per SEBI circulars.
content.rationale: To ensure transparency and provide investors with comprehensive information on the pricing, valuation, and counterparties involved in mutual fund transactions, facilitating informed investment decisions and regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Monthly Potential Outflow Factors for Open Ended Debt Schemes
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose monthly potential outflow factors categorized by investment size brackets (0-1 Cr, 1-5 Cr, 5-100 Cr, >100 Cr) separately for RaR and CRaR metrics, along with effective dates and scheme codes.
content.rationale: To provide investors and regulators with insights into liquidity risk and potential redemption pressures on open-ended debt schemes, aiding in risk assessment and management.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Monthly Risk-O-Meter Report
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose the monthly Risk-O-Meter level and value for each scheme, including effective dates and scheme codes. For debt schemes, credit risk value (CRV), liquidity risk value (LRV), and Macaulay duration should also be disclosed as per SEBI product labelling circular.
content.rationale: To enable investors to understand the risk profile of mutual fund schemes through standardized risk metrics, promoting transparency and informed investment choices.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Monthly Potential Risk Class Report
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose monthly Potential Risk Class (PRC) values for debt schemes, including CRV Class and IRRV Class, with effective dates and scheme codes, as per SEBI's Potential Risk Class Matrix circular.
content.rationale: To provide a standardized classification of credit and interest rate risks associated with debt schemes, facilitating better risk understanding for investors.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Allowed Asset Types and Instrument Types
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose the types of assets and instruments held in the scheme portfolio, using SEBI prescribed allowed values for asset types (e.g., Equity Shares, Corporate Bonds, Government Bonds, Derivatives, ETFs, etc.) and instrument types (Debt, Money Market, Equity, Equity Related Instruments, Others).
content.rationale: To ensure clarity on the composition of the scheme's portfolio, enabling investors to assess the nature and diversification of investments.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Security Ratings and Rating Agencies
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose the prevailing rating of each security used for valuation, specifying the lowest rating if multiple CRAs rate the security, including structured obligation (SO) and credit enhancement (CE) tags where applicable. The rating agency name must also be disclosed using SEBI approved rating agencies.
content.rationale: To provide investors with credit quality information of securities held, supporting risk assessment and compliance with valuation norms.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Investor and Transaction Details
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose investor master details (PAN, folio number, KYC status, demographic details), bank account details, distributor details, scheme master details (scheme code, name, category, sub-category, nature), plan master details (plan code, option code, open/close dates, ISIN, maturity date), NAV details, investor transaction details (transaction type, amount, units, NAV, statutory levies, transaction charge, broker code, transaction source), and investor holding details (unit balance, reinvest flag, demat flag, holding value).
content.rationale: To maintain comprehensive and transparent records of investors, transactions, and scheme details for regulatory oversight and investor protection.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Scheme Characteristics and Portfolio Norms
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose scheme categories, characteristics, portfolio concentration norms (including limits on illiquid securities not exceeding 15% of total assets), investment restrictions on various instruments (listed/unrated debt, structured obligations, non-convertible preference shares, venture capital funds, government guaranteed debt, securitised debt, short term deposits, overseas investments, IDRs, REITs/InvITs, derivatives, commodity derivatives), and norms for interval schemes/plans.
content.rationale: To ensure investors are informed about the scheme’s investment strategy, risk limits, and regulatory compliance, promoting transparency and prudent risk management.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Risk Management Framework and Related Policies
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose their Risk Management Framework (RMF) including policies, procedures, risk management functions, and roles and responsibilities of AMC management, Board of AMC, and Board of Trustees, specifically addressing liquidity risk management for liquid and overnight funds and prudential norms for open-ended debt schemes.
content.rationale: To demonstrate the mutual fund’s commitment to managing key operational and investment risks effectively, ensuring investor protection and regulatory compliance.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Restrictions on Transactions During Scheme Winding Up
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose that AMC, its sponsor, employees, and trustees are prohibited from transacting in units of schemes under winding up, with monitoring by the AMC and Trustee Boards.
content.rationale: To prevent conflicts of interest and protect investor interests during the winding-up process of schemes.

content.checklist_title: Disclosure of Product Labelling and Risk Metrics
content.checklist_description: Mutual funds must disclose product labelling details including Risk-O-Meter levels, Potential Risk Class matrix, and other risk-related metrics as prescribed by SEBI circulars on product labelling, ensuring these are updated monthly and reflect any changes in scheme risk profiles.
content.rationale: To provide investors with standardized and easily understandable risk information, aiding in informed investment decisions.
